We enjoyed our visit to this interesting and unique landscape. The paths are easy to follow. The only downside is that the development that is encroaching on the site detracts from the natural beauty of the spot. Overall worth a visit.

You will never be able to visit a place like this..... Valley of the Moon is a unique experience for anyone visiting La Paz. You feel as if you are really on what we know of what the moon looks like.... Recommended 100%

An interesting site, very popular in La Paz. It is a natural site full of eroded pieces of land. You can see some columns looking parts consisting of sandstone sand and again sandstone which proves thousands of year ago the area was covered by water. The formations are very
This place is very unlikely so close to La Paz but it was very interesting to see and the Age of the valley is impressive
Our group took a tour of the Valley of the Moon one afternoon and everyone loved it. The landscape is very unique and beautiful in a strange way. It's worth seeing if you're in La Paz.
Moon valley was nice itself to walk around. But the staff was so unwelcoming not letting us in around 4pm because the staff finishes at 6pm the lady at the office was very rude

Visited here as part of the city tour, it was our first stop. Lovely walk around the moonscape, lots of twists and turns some nice views. Went in the morning before the sun got too hot as there is no shade.

A collection of hoodoos just outside of La Paz. We enjoyed it in the morning mid week and only enountered a few other people. A cholita caretaker happily posed with us for pictures, even insisting we wear her bowler hat. Be careful not to drop anything as there's no going

We booked a 4PM sunset tour of the Valley de la Luna through Whipala Tours. The entrance of the Valley costs 3000CHP (2500CHP for students). The views are spectacular everywhere and look more like Mars than the Moon. We started with a walk through a salt cave, then hiked an hour

Just a 10km ride from the centre of La Paz lies The Valley of the Moons, a unique landscape formed by the wind. The monoliths are made from sandstone and have been eroded over centuries from the strong winds. Really a bit like on the moon. There are lots of little canyons and

We did Chacaltaya and Valle de la Luna together for about 60 Boliva each (a bargain at current rates) and this is one of the regular day trips offered by most tour companies and found it more fun and interesting than doing as part of a city tour. We did the Red Cap tour for our

This was part of our city tour and do we did only as short visite. Loved it and interesting to take some pictures. If you have more time you can do a full tour and I suppose this might take 2 hours all depending on how quick/slow you ant to walk. It is hot with little shade so
Unique valley with sand sculptures carved by the wind and rain, the area is very similar to the Cappodocia region of Turkey. ** somewhat inaccessible. Washrooms and shops are down a flight of stairs.

Good place if you like a walk between some strange rock formations. Actually there are some really nice similar rock formations further down along the river in a more natural and grander environment, where you do not have to pay an entrance fee. I go there a lot to walk. Never

This was okay for a couple of hours (max). It was a faff to get to and underwhelming when we got there. Don't get me wrong, it was really cool and interesting to see but I think we expected more. Worth doing if you have spare time in La Paz but don't be overly worried if you

The valley of the moon was a very interesting area of rock/sand/clay formations. We were told the area is eroding and will be gone in another 80-100 years. It does not take long to view the area but it is well worth the trip.

An awesome natural wonder.... And source of exercise! One of the most impressive things is the sheer size. Until you get amongst it you don't get an idea of the scale. It's a mad place.... And I'm not joking about hide and seek either! Let your hair down and try it! You'll need
Only 30 minutes drive from La Paz, Moon Valley is really like walking on another planet - the name was given by Neil Armstrong, and he should know !

So, so great! I felt like I just stepped into a Star Trek episode. It is so different and beautiful, a must see in La Paz. Definitely a rare beauty, go check it out! Easy to get there only takes one bus if you are visiting Zona Sur.
Its like standing in a desert with artistic sand expression - its truly god gifted natural formation. Littel away fro la Paz but certainly worth a visit.

A short escorted tour from downtown La Paz and I was wandering through this strange landscape, carved by the wind and rain over thousands of years in soaring temperatures . Worth a morning or afternoon if time permits while visiting La Paz.

This is an interesting place to go if you're in La Paz, but if you've seen other badlands (e.g. Badlands National Park, Theodore Roosevelt NP) you may be underwhelmed. When I went, there seemed to be a pervasive smell of garbage. Regardless, the trip down is interesting to see
If you visit La Paz city, please spend some time at Valle de la Luna and feel yourself as walking on the moon ;)
Amazing place. Fantastic views. Definitely worth a half day trip and with a tour group so you learn much more :)

I'll be honest, I didn't get a guide when I went here so I'm still clueless as to how this place was formed. That said, just wandering around for an hour or so was a nice, cheap way to spend an afternoon. This place can be accessed by bus from the city for just 2 bolivianos. I

This was the second half of a full day tour that started with visiting Chalcantaya ski resort. The landscape was interesting and I got some cool photos, but it was underwhelming. I had expected a much larger area than there was. Everywhere from moon valley you could see
It's a must when you are in La Paz. Amazing different a little bit tiring :) interesting geographic formations.

Valle de la Luna is a place full of interesting geographic formations .... While formations like these are commonplace - to an extent , what makes it interesting is the scale and how big the area is. The surrounding areas also look interesting , in reds and others colors. A
Went on a date here with my gal...wonderfully fun and relaxing and worth it. Easy to do in an afternoon and by yourself or with a group (even a big one).

This place was amazing and worth a day out to or even 1/2 a day Easy to get to and the place is very interesting with amazing out of this world scenery I was in town on business but as my hotel couldn't supply basic wifi in my room , I was forced outside to enjoy the sites

I did the trip for 25 bolivianos by using local transport. I caught a bus with Mallasi as the destination close to San Francisco. I asked the driver to tell me when we got to the right place. The colours of the rocks are beautiful and there is a path that takes 45 minutes
Nice place to go although not exciting. Good to spend an hour if you have nothing else to do. We had it as part of our day tour.
Relaxing walking tour for families and friends. Awesome to take pictures of incredible sights. It really looks as if you are on the moon.

Pleasant walk among bazar scenery with boulder mounted on narrow clay and sand pinnacles. Very nice walk to take with a small group after a noon meal that can be enjoyed at a local café. Best to tie in with a tour of city. Not a hard walk at all once accustom to the altitude.

Just on the outskirts of La Paz there is a park called Valley of the Moon. You can get there by taxi and we are told they will wait up to one hour for you to explore for 80 bolivianos. We just took the hop on hop off bus and they let us out for 20 minutes to take photos. It was

You can visit Moon Valley on a city tour or combine with e.g. visit to Chalcataya. Amazing landscape, best if the weather is good. Need approx 1 hour here. Plenty of great photo opportunities. Complete contrast to what you see in La Paz - was not expecting this on the edge of a

It was our privilege to visit this area prior to our reluctant departure from La Paz. The rovk formations remind me a little of Bryce Canyon in Utah, USA. It is definitely worth an hour of your time when you are visiting La Paz

This was a very enjoyable stop on a tour of La Paz. Outside the central city area, it is reminiscent of Capadoccia in Turkey, with natural spires and jagged formations formed by erosion. Not the kind of topography you might expect in an area surrounded by towering mountains,
One of the attractions here in La Paz, an incredible set of naturally sculptured sand stone which has resulted in a surreal setting.
The place is not so atractive to me. But it's a good place to kill some times when you are free in La Paz since it takes around 40 minutes to get there. The place is well organized.

An easy walk through some fascinating surreal landscape right in La Paz . At the highest point ---not very high-- there can be some strong winds. So if you take children on the walk, hold their hands. We had a good buffet lunch at a restaurant (we think in the Belevedere

This place was very interesting to visit as the landscape is so different from the rest of the area around La Paz. The trails are easy to navigate and there are great views from here. There are also some little shops with that carry local crafts and art work here.

Went there with a small group and walked several of the paths. Very interesting rock formations easily accessed by several paths of differing difficulty, but none too hard. Some of the views were spectacular.

I came here back in 2010 and found it very interesting. From what I recall they had like 2 or 3 different paths you can take. There were some parts of the path that seemed somewhat dicey to walk on but that just made it more exciting to walk through. Although its not a place

It is a great place to escape from the La Paz, something that you would not expect in the middle of such city. It is really good organized with city bus tour as it stops there for 20' so you can have time to enjoy it and then get back to the bus!
The valley is located just out side of La Paz. It has interesting rock formations. Takes a little less than an hour to hike through the site. If you have some free time it is worth a visit.
Nice place, but they have to learn how to became a touristic point the little roads must be fixed to be a great place

This very nice valley located just outside the city of La Paz is relatively small, but shows all the same traits of the Cappadocia valleys in Turkey, with unusual rock formations and amazing colours! Highly recommended if you're in the area!
Valle de la Luna is an area with unusual rock formations not far outside of La Paz. I spent about an hour there walking along the trails. It has interesting views all around.
After being in the city it was nice to get out into the open. Health and safety probably wouldn't pass it in the uk. There are quite a lot of places you could fall and the rails had seen better days.
Nice place in La Paz Bolivia to visit whith your family or friends,good view and good climate and environment.
Nice rock and earth formations to hike up and down. Very well displayed with different cactus plants spread all over.
The moon valley can be visited in half a day. It is a nice surrounding, but if you have only little time I would recommend to do other things in or around La Paz.

We visited the Valle de la Luna - it was in a beautiful part of town with a great view of La Paz... It's a nice hike and if you have some time in the afternoon this is great but it is far from the center of the city and not worth the trip.. If you go a little further up from
The pictures look a lot better than in person. It is much smaller than I thought but is very unique. Worth the look if you have the time.
This moon walk climb is very good.Very pretty site to climb walking enjoy the beauty.You must visit and spend and about an hour.

Valle de la Luna is a good place where you can see the other side of Bolivia. It is an interesting place because of the landscape. It is a leisurely place where you can do probably less than 2 hours to tour.
Fantastic, felt as though you are out of this world. well organized site and great visit. some hiking and hills, be ware.
Great outdoorsy experience, bring your tennis shoes to do the full climbing. The sightseeing is great and pretty different to what you normally get.

Cool valley located south of the city. There are two routes to take, one 15 minutes and one 45 minutes. Take the 45 minute route, but don't plan to stay much longer. A neat place to see, but 45 minutes is long enough.

When we went, it was quite. We didn't take a tour, we just wondered round. For anyone interested in geological landmarks, this is awesome. A cheap taxi ride out, and a fun way to kill an hour just outside la paz.
Amazing hike through incredible vistas. Bring a camera and a lunch. Good to spend the day and acclimatize when you first arrive in La Paz

This is a great area, so different to the rest of the natural environment we've seen. It is easy to get to by local transport and it is cheap.

Dried lake bed remainder after a natural dam burst leaving uniques structures Imagining it filled with water and scuba diving in it made it more interesting to me. Sort of like the bottom of a stalagmite cave with the top removed

Relax away from the city noise and come down to the natural formations. From there you can visit the zoo which is some blocks away. Take a horse trip. Rent a 4wheel or motorcicle. Or if you want to walk go down the road and come back to La Paz seeing the amazing mountains

This used to be Valley of the Spirits until Neil Armstrong likened it to the surface of the moon. It is startling to see this in the midst of a major urban area. If you are in La Paz, try to get away from the downtown and see this site. It will certainly add another dimension

Be prepared to take some good hiking boots and a good hat, its dusty and sunny, just like the moon :) some weird geological formations in a pretty large area, you can chose the 20min. or the longer hikes i think there´s even a 90min one. A great experience in general, better in
best way to see moon valley. use motorcycle bolivia tours. do a minimum of 3 hour tour and you won't regret it
Very lunar, they actually named the area "the moon" because of one of our astrounaut visiting it, and saying it was moon like. It was beautiful.

I did not manage to see it from inside, as it was closed when we reched there ( and we spent only one day and 2 nights in Bolivia) From outside it looked beautiful and different. If I will return to Bolivia, for sure this will be the firts place to visit again, so can see it
Beautiful natural formations... too bad lots has been destroyed for housing. Be sure to take water and a snack.

The Valle de la Luna is a very interesting place to walk through. It is not very expensive and you can take the 45 minute route to get the most for your money. The valley is also very close to La Paz so you can easily get there by cab for cheap. However I would recommend that
The scenery is very different, lunar appears a good description, but nothing changes during the whole walk around. Worth a 30 minute look.

This place is so interesting, such a different type of land scape and really looks like you're on the moon. Had a great guide but since it's located at the bottom of the city anyone can go there easily and just pay the entrance fee.

This is a really cheap afternoon trip from La Paz, we spent a couple of hours there pottering around and climbing on the rocks and had a great time. Taxi up there should be quite cheap and the entrance is similarly small (can't remember exactly how much). Definitely a lot more

It is like a moonscape with all the erosion and construction work around it. Valle de la Luna is worth at least a short visit especially if it is part of a city tour. See its photos before decising if it is for you. I did the short visit and did not take the hour-long long

This quite small but interesting area is really worth a visite. The canyon like structures are beautiful to wander around. Be sure to wear sensible shoes, as there's a lot of climbing up and down, and the ground has quite a few holes dug out by the rain. It gets very hot here

Moon Valley is a highlight of a La Paz visit. It's otherworldly and great to see. There are two walking options (a quick 15 minute visit, and a longer 45 minute loop). Both allow you to see the rock formations and take photos. It's a short drive out from the main historic

The place is nice, with very interesting rock formations. It's not an attraction that will blow you away but it's still worth visiting if you have time to spare. There are two paths to choose from - 45min walk and 15min walk. We went for a 45 min one although I am guessing the

We take the tour bus in the downtown of La Paz to the south area of the city, we go through the richest neighborhoods to end in a valley that is so impressive that you start to imagine millions of years before the city was there all the valley maybe was cover with water o maybe

Having been to many a Moon Valley ( in Namibia and Chile), didn't have very high expectations from this. However once we reached there, we were blown away by the beauty of the place. Spent a good 1.5 hours exploring and walking through well marked routes. Key positives -

It was ok to visit but I could easily have lived without it. It's a small area and the cliffs aren't that high. I don't know why it's in all the tourist books. The lesser known Valle de las Animas has much higher cliffs and is more adventurous to visit. Take a bus towards Palca

I wouldn't go out of my way to visit this site as I found it less than appealing. Some of the walkways were not overly safe. The formations took a lot of imagination to work out what they were. Mind you we have been to the North American National Parks, so have been spoilt.
Never seen so many beautiful mountains, you can enjoy the view as it would be in something of other world.
In this area of La Paz you really do feel like you are on the moon. The dirt "craters" are so realistic. If you are lucky you will get to see some chinchillas as they scurry from mound to mound.

It's a cool place located not too far from the city center. It only takes you around 20 minutes by a cab. If you have time, just pay a visit here. It takes around an hour to walk through the Moon Valley. Overall an exotic experience but it's not something that you cannot be
I booked with kanoo tours for this trip, Valle de la luna was a great walk and beautiful to see. I just felt a bit rushed as we only had 45 minutes to visit this place.

Its a beautiful place to go. There are a small reception and you need to pay a little fee to get inside. There are two options of walk one in 15 minutes and other 45 minutes. I take the biggest one and was amazing. PS: Don`t forget your water.

Valle de La Luna is a cool moonlike landscape outside of La Paz. The surrounding area is beautiful with mountains as far as the eye can see. Valle de la Luna costs 15 bolivianos to enter and takes about an hour to hike through. It's an otherworldly place, but definitely not

Moon Valley is a very unique place. Conveniently placed in the souther part of the city of La Paz, Valle de La Luna is a perfect place to vist in the morning or at sunset.
Cheap entry . Small site but you can get great photos. Really moon like. Great against the blue sky we had

About 15 mins from the town, this place is something you wont experience while walking around La Paz. Nice to see, interesting natural forms, helpfull staff, and a different place to spend an hour or two walking around and exploring.

Pretty good attraction that you can bike to easily enough. Seems like a bit of a slog on the way there, but it's actually mostly downhill on the way back and you can see the sunset and get back in time to drop the rental bikes off in time before most places close. Defo recommend
i liked that it had a trail.... hmmm it didnt have a guide... i didnt like the part that it is too far away from downtown
Great pics and a big mistery can come to your mind when entering this place. The staff always helpful and the conservation of the path always present over there.
Why is it so popular? It is small and the photos look more impressive. Pass it by and visit somewhere else.

I had no idea what to expect but as we drove upwards from the centre of LaPaz it got more and more intriguing. My guide was giving me lots of information, which was extremely interesting but I thoroughly enjoyed the walk through the area. Should I return to LaPaz I would
Went on Four-Wheelers, enjoyed the views and solitud. You won't regret the ride. Bring a beer to enjoy once you reach the top, because you can't buy anything.
There are so many wonderful things to see and do in La Paz, but this one is not so special. For some reason, many tours stop there.
google: It is a unique landscape.. But the emphasis seems to be to buy flutes etc! Get away from the crowd and just walk and climb. That's a real workout at the same time. Magnificent backdrop of hills and mountains. 15 Bob to enter
Beautiful place for a small hike. It is quite far from the center of town and the bus is all but comfortable. The place itself is beautiful, but everything looks quite the same.

Self guided half day tour.  No need to go with your group.  It’s pretty safe even I came during the chaotic time in Bolivia. People are extremely nice. 
As for the view it’s good but you may see similar but more striking impressive sceneries.
Lovely and quiet place. Evening, sunset time was perfect time to visit for me.
beautiful view, but kind of dangerous. if you 0lan to come here with children, please make sure they stick close to you at all times. otherwise, very beautiful place, very breathtaking.

Google said they are open until 5:30pm. We got there at 4:40pm. The lady at the entrance gate said they are closed at 4pm. and didn’t let us in. We’ve traveled from far away to visit this place. And we don’t have much time to stay in La Paz. I’m so disappointed. Hopefully they are clear with their hour.
Nice spot to relax not too far from the city center
It's a nice place to just look around and click some pics. Other than that i don't think it has something interesting.

Dramatic landscape, great spot for photos, meditation (on a quiet day during off season) and a nice walk. 

The entrance is 3 bolivianos for locals and 15 for foreigners. 

It is easy to get here from La Paz by public transport, ‘colectivo’ minibús. This journey will cost just 2.60 bolivianos each way.
Surely interesting geological rock formation. However, the site is surrounded by houses and it doesn't have a feeling of special site. No shops, no restaurants.

Erosion at its very best. Dry to the extreme, an interesting place to visit if you are in La Paz with two hours to kill. Fee to enter less than $3. Some parts of the trail outside the main path are a bit scary with no handrail in sight. Overall a must see.

Great spot for interesting geology and formations. For lighting avoid am as the sun cast large shadows. Best to go around noon or later. No handicap accessible. No guard rails in some areas so be careful but worth a visit.
Spectacular rock formation near La Paz center!!
Nice geological formation. A bit too close to the city, that remove some of the charm of the place.

Minibus will get you there from downtown for cheap, but the ride’s about 45 minutes. Can probably count on spending no more than an hour walking the trail. Plenty of steep walking paths like the city, but with better scenery.

You don’t need to take expensive tour to Valle de la Luna. Easy to get there by Teleferico and mini bus. My hostel was located near by blue line, so took it and changed green line to end.  Walk 10mins to Calle 8 Calacoto and take a minibus …
A beautiful place with a stunning views and an interesting history. Take a city tour and you will not be disappointed.
Interesting place to visit if nothing else to do in La Paz. To get there and back from center can take long, specially in rush hours. Walk there is just around 45 min.
Awesome. This is mis is it in La Paz
Worth a visit. Nice park with interesting and beautiful rock formations.

Beautiful and cool to see, but some photos can be misleading as they don't show the true size of the geological formations. Don't expect colossal mountains, but there are some very cool sightseeing spots and it can be a relaxing place if there's not too many people.
Amazing place, is like to real moon

It's an amazing sight to behold. Easy to get to by bus, I spent about 2 hours there wandering around and marveling at the spires and remains of erosion. You can 'do it' faster if you don't have time, but it's worth the trip if you have half a day. There are places where you can fall if you wander off the main route and are not careful.

Incredible place to be.  Rock formation are amazing.  There is a charge for entrance. Its at a altitude of 3600 plus above sea level.  So travellers dont exert yourself.  Take it easy.  They loose points because their direction are very …

I'm giving this 5 stars because it is simply beautiful and it's a must see if you are visiting La Paz. Make sure you wear plenty of sunscreen as there is barely any shade. I would wear a hat and keep hydrated. They say follow the arrows but they are all mixed up...that is my only complaint. Again...this place is simply beautiful.

I can see how this place is interesting from a geological perspective but the expansive and ugly human development around it completely detracts from any reason to enjoy it now. Wouldn't recommend a visit unless you happen to be in the area.
There are better places further away fr houses and roads that are still accessible.

F a n t a s t i c !
You can take a tour and visit Chacaltaya the same day ...
You will enjoy both

Really unique out of this world landscape! But after walking around for a bit the whole place pretty much looks the same. 

Took a cable car over and the got a taxi directly to the entrance instead of taking the bus.
Nice place to visit with a good viewpoint. It will take you around 45 minutes to walk around.
Worth the visit if it's part of your guided city tour. Nice but not a must-see
A cool 1 or 2 hour trip to the very strange place. It looks like a set from Star Wars. Bring water and SUNSCREEN. It is cool but not an OMG YOU NEED TO SEE THIS cool.
It's ok..
Gorgeous place.. Easy hike. The entry cost is 15 bolivianos which is a little expensive. Other than, enjoyed our visit to this place thoroughly!
Amazing place, 15 and 45 mins routes but it takes longer than that 'cause of how breathtaking it is, chill out, bring water and have and amazing time. 15 bolivianos for tourists

I liked it very much. It is a very different landscape. It is supposed to be the closest to the moon landscape on earth according to astronaut Neil Armstrong. The visit is short you can walk around and see the rock formations. i recommend it.
Beutiful natural phenomenon in the midst of the city - very easy to access.
Cool rock formations that are only 30 mins drive from downtown La Paz.
I love this place, but it is necessary more security

Very cool rock formations pretty close to La Paz. Def recommend as a few hours to get out of the city. We didn’t take the teleférico and bus/taxi , which we heard was fairly easy. But we did have our hostel call us a taxi, which we paid 140 Bolivianos to take us there, wait an hour, and drive us back.
Its a beautiful park to walk around and take nice photos. Its bloody hot thou. And have to wear long sleeves due to sun radiation.
Well worth a visit and close to La Paz. There and back in under 2 hours including time to take the longer path around the moon.
Very nice place to go and just chill a little bit, the rocks are amazing here and you can take a lot of nice pictures
Very cool, nice birds and viscacha
Was an interesting place to visit.  But it's over populated with homes around the rock formations which ruins the vibe.
A must-see place around La Paz.
Wonderful place!
Great place to take a motor bike and ride for two to three hours, really liked it was tons of fun and around 150bs for 2hours
Nice to see, but not my highlight in La Paz
"Mallasa valley"' it is an extrange formation of rocks from about 4500 millions of years,  spectacular view of mountain moon scenery. It is about 45 minutes by car from La Paz city

Super cool landscape! Looks alien. The guide told us that it was an American astronaut that said it resembles a moon landscape - hence the name.
It is all made of clay, and therefore its shapes will constantly alter and eventually deteriorate😥

Really cool park not too far out of the city. The hike around the park is pretty easy and the rock formations are very unique and picturesque. It really does feel like you’re walking on another planet! 😊👍

If you've never seen these kind of pinnacles before, then you may enjoy this more, especially with a guided tour for more information about how the valley was formed. Though we've seen some quite grand views of other pinnacles so for us it was an unfair comparison I feel.

We went when it was raining. Good thing - very few people. Bad thing - super muddy and slippery. I highly recommend hiking shoes if you come during bad weather. The place is a nice escape from the city. Cost 15Bs per person for entrance fee. The place looks like it'll erode soon so go soon.

A cool place to see...be ready to walk

Good experience, really beautiful place. Unfortunately there's only a few places where you can stand and watch, without having a path or some other tourists in your field of view.

Go for an hour or so, have a good time, but don't expect to get close to nature :)

text.wiki:
The Witches' Market, also known as El Mercado de las Brujas and La Hechiceria, is a popular tourist attraction located in Cerro Cumbre, a mountain clearing in La Paz, Bolivia. Merchandise sold in The Witches' Market, run by local witch doctors known as yatiri, includes potions, dried frogs, medicinal plants like retama and armadillos used in Bolivian rituals. The yatiri can be easily identified by their black hats and coca pouches containing amulets, talismans and powders that ensure luck, beauty and fertility. Most famous of all the items sold in The Witches' Market are the dried llama fetuses. These llama fetuses are buried under the foundations of many Bolivian houses as a sacred offering to the goddess Pachamama.

The Mercado de Las Brujas, otherwise known as the witches market, is a common tourist attraction near the downtown area in La Paz. It is a unique market full of ancient remedies and unique items. Llama fetuses are displayed everywhere, as the locals commonly bury them underneath
The Witches market is a great place if you are looking for handcrafted goods in La Paz. Easy accessable too.

Also known as the ‘witches market’, this regular La Paz tourist attraction is a area of streets lined with Aymara vendors. Yatiri are Aymara witch doctors, women wearing black hats and coco pouches who offer cures for ailments and ingredients for rituals. Everything from

Bolivian handicrafts are beautiful, this is a place to find at a more than reasonable price and you can compare from one store to the other in just one block, then you forget to buy souvenirs or gifts to relatives or friends...
Having traveled the world, many of these markets look the same. This is enough different to make it interesting. Worth seeing.

A few streets of stores that sell everything remotely witchy. Some store owners can speak English so they can give you a very good explanation of what each trinket is for. Overall very interesting if you wish to delve into the symbolism and rituals of the Bolivian people.

Having seen some disappointed reviews online about the market, we weren't sure what to expect. Yes, the vendors are mainly catering to tourists and yes, it is actually a littler smaller than expected. However, if you take the time to explore all the shops, alleyways and

This was a block from my hotel. I visited it on my first day and didn't think too much of it. I took a picture or two and moved on. Enjoy!!

this place have a lot of things related to our mistic culture, have preparationes for our health, job, love or destroy the bad feelings of another people... Its need to take with serious actitude have another options to drink, food and see some "coca readers" to see your

Interesting market with lots of vendors and people and colors and smells but you may not enjoy the llama fetuses and other disgusting things on display all around. And you quickly realize it's a "seen one seen all" kind of place.

Lots to browse and buy along the street of the Mercado de las Brujas. Some really good quality souvenirs - jumpers, bags, jewellery etc. Most of the people along the street are very fair and friendly. Be careful though, there are some that will completely rip you off if you

We ended up helping the woman use WhatsApp to connect with her son in Brazil. The result was a sweet interaction and she was extra psyched to bless some trinkets for my friends. I also bought some hilarious premise spells for friends.
