Did a tour. Our guide was very friendly and spoke great English. It was great to hear the history of the Monastery and Bolivia. Out on the roof top you can see the great bells and views of the city. A must see.
Beautiful, among a circuit of really beautiful ornate churches in the area all in walking distance of each other.
There wasn't really much inside. It has a pretty outside, so worth walking to, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go see it.
There is a tour inside that you can do for less than 2 pounds. It's great cause it takes you to the secret areas of the Church. You will be happily surprise.
Heart of the city great old Cathedral well kept. Tour was well worth it and views very pleasant. Would recommend it.
This cathedral gives you a taste of what European cathedrals must have been like before war stripped them of their finery. Colorful and glittering, and filled with worshipers of every class.
Had a great guide to take us around the buildings which were lovely. Great views from the bell tower!

I just enjoyed the concert of a Bolivian youth orchestra in this very special colonial church, with pieces composed by both Bolivian and western composers. Therefore, in this complex you can see some exquisite religious artwork, and visit the museum to get a better understanding
Its a beautiful temple and the museum its amazing, you can stand on roofs and see al the antiques. Its great!
Huge and very old church at the bottom of Sagarnaga street. It is good to see it once or to escape the madness from outside.

This is tipped as one of the most beautiful churches in Bolivia and it certainly lived up to that reputation. I was fortunate to enter the church at the beginning of mass and was able to join in the service and receive a blessing at the alter.

Wonderful, old cathedral in the heart of La Paz, just down the hill from one of the great shopping streets for artisan works. I wish they had been a little more gracious about allowing photographs. Maybe charge a small fee?
If you like churches, this is not to be missed. Great example of the inclusion of indigenous motifs within the Christian themes. The museum associated with the church is also very interesting.
A central meeting/chill out point on the outside and a lovely serene, calming place on the inside. Nice to catch mass here too.

okay. Not spectacular. Many local folks there, and some tourists as well. Well located in the center, and close to calle sagarnaga, the touristic street for artesania....Gd place to stop by and pray for my trip....And thank God for the peace and rest afforded me by the church
It is crowd outside, be careful. Inside and roof walk .. and a great view.
For me it was just a time filler, nothing more. Had it been a nicer day I´d of gone somewhere else.

But nothing amazing. It has a nice architecture, but there aren't any guides in the place explaining its history

the church is beautifull but the guides are not good i went to this church with my best friends and we wanted somebody to guide us in the church and we wanted somebody that culd speak english because we dont speak spanish but they dont any guides that speaks english we were very

Great architecture. Going to the rooftop was great.

I liked this church because of the distinctively South American way baroque decor was interpreted, with statues of holy figures clothed in elaborate garb, and that a service was still drawing worshippers.
I was in awe at the church and its beautiful altars, paintings etc. Unfortunately there is no photography allowed, same goes for the Museum which is overpriced at 20B.
You can feel the history in this place, too bad you're not allowed to take pictures, and it's very strcitly inforced.
There is a lot of hustle and bustle outside the church but once you enter its tranquil and orderly. I am told that the accompanying museum is worht a visit.
this church has very nice statues and paintings, the entrance is lovely and decorate everywhere.
It was too caotic! They are working on Calle Sagarnaga, therefore trying to walk around is not easy.

More or less in the center of La Paz you will find this old wonderful and beautiful church. The ceiling is wonderful decorated and the peace inside is fantastic. That day we almost had the church for our self.

Lots to see with the museum, painting gallary, roof view, crypt, AND church. Guided tour wasn't great (rushed us through the interesting, gave too many details in the boring) but DEFINITELY worth the time. Took about an hour and a half.

This place is amazing you can find history of La Paz at any step you take

trip: You really can't go to La Paz without "doing" the malecon. It's a central attraction in the city, really, spanning the harbour front and providing fodder for people-watching, appreciating the harbour, finding good food, and getting some exercise. There is lovely public art, a

We were lucky enough to have a day and a half to spend walking in La Paz. While the Cathedral plaza was very torn up with construction the Malecon was a delightful stroll. The second day was a Sunday when the car traffic is closed for at least half of the day. Families of
a wonderful sunset walk where sky colors start changing as soon as the sunset begins, if it so relaxing to walk during the sunset in the malecon! we had a great time

In La Paz you can enjoy a walk of 4 kms and unforgettable sunsets on the Sea of Cortez. I suggest you a visit at the handycraft centre where the prices of the work are bargain indeed. The place is really huge and peaceful, but especially very clean.
Great walking area right downtown on the water. Lots of stores/shops and outdoor vendors. Good places to grab food or cafe all along the way. Plenty of parking on the street or just a block up.

We walked down to the Malecon every day. It is so nice to stroll along watching the people enjoying themselves, the children playing and the sun sparkling on the beautiful water. Having something like this within walking distance of your home would be mind-blowing!

La Paz is a great place to visit if you're looking for a spot off the beaten path and a more "local" experience. You won't find a lot of night clubs, but you will find a beautiful malecon with families, teens, and couples cruising and enjoying the beautiful Sea of Cortez.

La Paz is an extraordinarily beautiful town. No big resorts or towering mega hotels, just a laid back stunningly pretty town, and the Malecon along its waterfront is a gem. There are plenty of boutique (and while excellent, wildly inexpensive) restaurants all along the
Nice sculptures, great views, perfect for people watching. Crowds ebb and flow due to time of day and season
We rented bikes and rode the length of it and back. Stopped at various points-- sculptures, pier, exercise parks, ice cream at La Fuenta.
Gorgeous waters, turquoise blues gentle bays filled with tropical fish! Swimming with sea lions adventure!!

The Malecón is a oversized boardwalk along the Sea of Cortez running about a 2 mile stretch. My sister and I walked it every night we were there and felt safe. It is well lite and there are many people until about 10. We made sure we were back at hotel by then. There are lots
We walked the Malecon on two different visits, and enjoyed the scenery (beautiful sunsets), as well as the convenience to many restaurants. It was fun to see all ages enjoying the Malecon.

This Malecon has so many beautiful and whimsical statues. They are truly a joy. The water is beautiful, the pelicans are interesting to watch. On the other side of the street are numerous shops and cafes. This is our favorite place in La Paz

Quite beautiful and clean. We’ve walked down here quite a few times since being here (it’s currently carnival so there are tons of booths set up). Other than the carnival stuff there are lots of restaurants and bars. Lots of cool art too

Malecon becomes alive at night. And if your lucky enough to get one of there breathtaking sunsets!! It is a beautiful to stroll to look at all the Sculptures. Or to get a good work out in, Its about 31/2 miles,or more one way. With a separate bike lane. Beautifully done, its fun

Walked the entire distance of the malecon and its beautiful. Lots of art along the way - statues and street are up the side streets. Beautiful views of the coastline. Also saw a variety of birds along the shore during low tide.

The Malecon is a great place to walk. There are restaurants, cafes and tourist information centers. There are 7 interesting and beautiful sculptures along the wide walkway.The colors of the water are varied with shades of blue and green.La Paz is a beautiful city where the sea

Beuatiful, very clean, wonderful sculptures and other art. We absolutely loved walking along or sitting and people watching. So nice that it has few American tourists :) Makes you feel like you are off the beaten path
Al walk on the promenade does wonders for your relaxation and senses. So peaceful I enjoyed every minute of it.
There were many beautiful statues along the Malecon. It was very nice to see the different aspects of of the area represented as peices of art.

I love La Paz's Malecon. When you walk along the Malecon, you are absorbed into Mexico, surrounded by local families taking walks, groups of friends chatting, joggers running after (or before) work, young folks skating along on roller skates or boards.. The Malecon is broad
This is a lovely place to take a walk and watch the people, the boats and generally enjoy the area. Plenty of places to sit for a while and gaze out to sea.

The Mala on really is wonderful...everyone omes out to walk in the evening... tourists, families with young children etc. There are numerous sculptures and statues from one end to the other. There's even a separate bike lane!

Love this newly finished walkway in LaPaz. This is where all the locals and tourists spend their Friday and Saturday nights, walking, riding bikes, skateboarding, etc up and down this wide sidewalks. Gorgeous statues dot the area. Very clean and festive. The place to be!!

We had a decent time visiting the Melecon, but it was not something I would say hey lets go and return. The city needs some serious modernization and more touristy updating. It is not that great for tourists in my opinion and the restaurants are nothing to rave about so really I

Beautiful to walk and bike on. Very clean! Loved all the sculptures/ statues. The bike lane is very well maintained and there are excellent ice cream shops along the way. Not very touristy, not a lot of shopping.
Such a beautiful area with fantastic sculptures to walk around and see. Special separate lanes for bikes to cruise around and see the Malecon.
Great place for a peaceful walk overlooking the water and if you are a runner, the maleçon is about 6km point to point. Great scenery, local food, playgrounds and markets. Worth a visit.
not as big as Cabo, but interesting litte downtown. Great restaurants and lots of cute little shops. The area is not too tourist-y, so it's more laid back.

Gorgeous scenery, lovely flowers, amazing art and statues, and plenty of happy people. Walk the whole thing from Marina Cortez to Marina Palmira to really experience La Paz's living room and the gorgeous sea views! Plenty of restaurants, bars, ice cream, steet vendors, and

The La Paz Malecon is great walkway overlooking the water, with seats, playgrounds, beach areas and even fitness stations to make use of. There is also a cycle way that goes along the whole Malecon. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and icecream shops across the road to
Its a great place for a nice evening walk. There are locals, local food and the beautiful sunset. The beach is nice.... but not much of beach walking. Enjoy the trip.

The Malecon in La Paz is on the bay side of the frontage road. There are a number of sculptures along the way. You get a great vista of the bay along it’s entire length. A separate bike way exists between the walkway and the frontage road. Bike rentals are available. Across

Beautiful place to walk, not crowded and lots of statues to take pictures with. My favorite was the one depicting the pearl industry from bygone days. Gorgeous view of the sea, playgrounds for the kids, lots of shopping and restaurants. I loved it. So quiet and no sales
You can walk ---- and walk all while having Great Views. Tired of Walking ---- cross the street to grab a bite or a drink. Feels safe.
many locals come out in the evening to walk or cruise along the Malecon. It is a very family oriented occasion and is most enjoyable!

Really enjoyed walking this malecon every day I was in town. It has a park for kids, a wharf where all of the tours launch from, and many restaurants and shops. During December, it also has a ton of festivities for Feliz Navidad!

We absolutely loved La Paz. It’s got plenty of tourist infrastructure but light years away from the mess that is Cabo. Walking on the Malecon is totally safe day or night (maybe don’t do it too late). Lots of restaurants and bars along the beachfront, without ring too
This is an amazing water front. Plenty sidewalk, statues and a great view. Real safe and parking was easy, unless at super busy times. Had really good food and drink after my whale shark tour.

La Paz is a quiet little town with not a bunch of touristy things. my group went to La Paz for the nature so we didnt explore the actual city too much. The Malecon is something not to be missed though. The statues are beautiful and you cant beat the view as you walk along the
La Paz is a great little day trip from Cabo... be sure to go to the Playa Balandra too! The whole trip gives you a much better feel for Baja...
Malecon is a nice and clean Street direct on the water. We were lucky to see some Christmas dance battles.
Five miles of calm pathways for walking by the shore with a seperate double cycle lane, lined with palms and sculptures and dotted with seating areas, small beaches and the odd cafe.

We always stay close to the Malecon, so many great places to eat, see and do there. The marina is right there and it's the best place for people watching and taking a stoll after dinner. For more authentic food try some of the restaurants up a few blocks from the Malecon. One
Must do! Get gelato, check out the people and the sculptures and rent banana bikes - 40 pesos/hour and cruise around.
The Malecon is fun to drive or walk or bike through... If you have access to a bike, there is a very spacious niking path right along the beachfront.

Lovely. Late evening everybody from kids on skate board to old folks strolling and enjoying the breeze. Utterly safe. No hustlers or pesky vendors. Tasty cafe's across the street. Nice sculptors of Dolphins and other sea life.

It is a perfect place for a family, couples etc to come for a stroll after lunch or dinner, full of beautiful art and bars and restaurants, close to beach so on a hot day you can have a refreshing swim - but it is colourful and calm place for everyone.

Come, grab an ice cream nearby, and just sit and watch the La Paz community in action ... much of it on wheels: bicycles, skateboards, skates, baby carriages. Quite charming all times of day. There is also a special playground just for wheelchair riders!
The malecón was well kept, clean, beautifully maintain with all the palms and flowers and I mostly Like the center stage for special events.

Stroll, rollerskate, or cycle along this beautiful and unspoiled boardwalk, punctuated with evocative sculptures and lined with restaurants and shops. The views across the bay are beautiful, and there is a lovely restaurant right on the beach, Estrella del Mar, which is

I would rank the Malecon in La Paz as the best attraction in La Paz. The waterfront path has a combination of beautiful art works, parks, wide open paved paths for walking, biking, etc. And the views of the Sea of Cortes are beautiful. When the weather nice for being
I have been in La Paz for five years and gave up the joke that is the Malecon about 4 and a half ago.

La Paz has the best sunsets in the world and walking by it’s Malecon will let you savor them and the people that live in this wonderful place. The government recently made improvements and it looks absolutely beautiful. Full of benches to sit and watch people go by and many

Really enjoyed walking here. Also has a very well designed bike lane. Beautiful sculptures line the walkway and has a wonder family friendly plaza that is well lit. Nicest Malecón I have found in Baja.
Wide walkways with plenty of benches to sit at and enjoy the view. Tons of statues and even a playground for the kids. There is also a great bike path.

I live in Cabo which has lots of off-road places to bike but really doesn't have anyplace to take a leisurely ride with people and scenes to take in like say Mission Beach in SD. So I bought a sailboat in La Paz to stay for long weekends and ride along the Malecon. Always

Walking the 5 km malecon is a must, and not just once. It will soon become a daily event for you with various entertainment on the weekends, people watching, eating take out food and of course exercising. The locals are very active on their Malecon,

A beautiful walk alongside the beach and amazing energy of the local culture, always busy and loaded with excellent shops, hotels, restaurants and booths offering local authentic foods, textiles, art and jewelry. Lots to see, lots to take in!

A great place to soak in the sights and sounds of La Paz. Lots of bars, restaurants and cafes. We felt very safe and the area was pretty clean. People were very helpful and were able to pick up on my poor Spanish speaking skills.
La Paz has done a fantastic job improving, lengthening and keeping the Malecon for both the locals and visitors. Beautiful walk along the water, several restaurants to choice from.
The city is a beautiful place, the malecon is a very quiet and beautiful place to walk at the end of the afternoon. I recommend watching the sunset.
Great place for a nice walk, skate, cycle or jog. Local people flock the Malecón as the sun sets and heat goes down.
Take a stroll along the Malecon and see all the shops, while you walk along the water. Such a great place to take the family at night, after dinner and walk along the water with your ice cream.

Both of my places were off El Malecon, I loved it. Very scenic, with plenty of restaurants, bars, shops along the beachfront. Spicy hot, but totally worth it. There are built in beach umbrellas but due to the heat, they may be taken up, so something to consider. I spent many an
Such a beautiful walk along the beach, there is several restaurants and shops. There is a marina. There is a bike lane for those that wish to ride bikes.

Great place for everyone, from families with kids, couples, fitness junkies, to everyone it is the main place to chill at La Paz. Full or restaurants, ice cream shop's , few night clubs and loads of bars with the beach view. Great to place to watch the most beautiful

La Paz is a wonderful place to visit. It is less commercial than Cabo. Lots of families come out and walk the Malecon in the evening, when the sun is going dow. Only the stupid Americans walk in the mid day sun, 100 degrees.. Nice walk along beach to watch beautiful sunsets and

Really enjoyed a couple-hour walk here. I was in La Paz in the 80s, and this place has definitely changed. Bring your camera. Take a walk. Don't recommend swimming in the beach. Sewer drains empty into the bay.
Nice place to spend the day during winter months. Sept-March give or take. Check local calendars for fun events or just enjoy the day strolling , taking in the scenery and having a nice meal.
Great views of the Bay with many excellent restaurants along the walk. Work is being done to continue it and improve the area. Great place to experience the local community.

The malecón is the place to go in La Paz. It’s a beautiful paved walkway next to the sea, with many fine sculptures along it. It’s three miles long, great for walks, jogs, skateboarding, biking, etc. It was recently completely redesigned and redone (it’s still under construction
Good place to hang out. Can get crowded at times. Nice place to walk and veiw the ocean. Great place to people watch. Great place to enjoy your ice cream. Jeff Off Road Anglers
my fav palce to eat is tail hunters, they have good food and Jonathan and Jilly are great people. nice pace to walk and enjoy the day, i see Yoga on the sand and lots of vendors hocking thier wares

Walk along the Malecón is a beautiful walk. Lots of restaurants, ice cream and paleteria shops, and bars. Great for people watching. Get a paleta de nieve or an agua fresca and sit on a bench, people watch and watch the sunset. You will not be disappointed.
We could walk there during day (very few people) and swim and night. At sunset there are mycg more people in a very cool ambiance. We eat at rancho viejo and had a great time.

Highly recommend for strolls or bike riding. Attractions like restaurants, shops, and ice cream parlors border the malecon. Easy access for wheelchair or stroller. Beautiful, safe, and well maintained. Close to downtown.

We always see different events as we walk the malecon and plenty of bars and restaurants to choose from on the other side. Great idea to close down the street on Sunday mornings and let the bikers and walkers use the street too.
we had a beautiful walk in the famous malecon of la paz with our family and dogs but one thing we wont do again is bring the dogs because they just kept barking to other people dogs
it was very relaxing to walk in the malecon while seing all the sculpture from different life forms all over, nice
I was very impressed with the Malecon. Scrubbed clean with lovely sculptures, a bike path ran along side and the beach on the opposite was raked and studded with public palapas.

This is such a beautiful part of the city. Lots of space and nice breezes. Beautiful views. Great for people watching. There is play equipment, including some for people in wheelchairs, as well as bike paths and bike rentals. I walked here every night I was in town.

My overall thoughts on LaPaz...Gorgeous beaches and crystal waters, but tourism has declined and the town itself is very run-down A lot of boarded up businesses and graffiti. The malecón is great place to walk or bike or roller blade. Lots of families and couples strolling
The Malacon is truly a beautiful place. It has several unique statues and it is highly used. Please do not bring your dogs! New rule by the City.
when you are in la paz you have to have a walk on the malecon you will not regret that for the nice breeze
With all the bustling shops accross the street the Malecon was a nice peaceful walking area right on the water. Many area paved for blading or biking.

We stayed on the Malecon for two nights. The parks and boardwalks were great spaces for our children to stretch their legs. There are lots of restaurants to choose from as well. If you are staying in La Paz I would highly recommend a visit to the Malecon.
Dont miss this walk in the afternoon to see the sunset. Have an ice cream in La Fuente and rent bicycles in that corner.
We took several walks along the bay, best in the evening, but we loved the Malecon and all the public art.

However they are doing remodelation, the malecon is nice you have postal views with a quiet sea! you may walk any time and at night there is alot of people who enojoyed the sunset for a family ride, doing skating or cycling.
This is s lovely area next to the ocean. Many shops and restaurants and some hotels. Very popular on weekends and holidays.

The malecon was surprising clean, well maintained, nice place to walk along the shoreline. All the restaurants and shops are across the street. They are working on part of it to make the beach area bigger, and fixing up a section so a little construction going on. Tons of
Nice place to walk by and take pictures or grab some food, dessert, a drink etc... almost everything is on this street

This malecon is great for a nice walk, somewhere around 7 miles round trip. It would of been better, however there is a big patch of construction happening. There was a bike race being set up and you had to move around equipment being set up. -
I don't remember the name of the shop but it was near the southern (?) end of the main drag, facing beach, thinking it was close to statue of woman, I'll try to attach.
Very beautiful stretch of the Sea of Cortez. Blue water & sky, long stretch of gorgeous ocean, lots of shops and restaurants across the street. This area feels safe and laid back.
One of the best boerdwalks I’ve been on. Jog, eat, sightsee. Great sunsets, lots of coffe shops and restaurants. Some construction going on.

We visited the Malecon several times during our stay in La Paz. Lots of restaurants, bars, etc. all along the strip. We were they during Carnaval, so we got to experience the parade as well. Fun stuff!
Great place for everything! Watching a sunrise or sunset, walking, running, biking and then afterwards you just head across the street for dinner and/or drinks.

The city of La Paz spends a great deal of time and effort keeping their waterfront looking pristine. The 3-4 miles of beautiful sidewalk/bike path are one of La Paz's best features. Even during Carnaval, the huge mess that got made every night was very quickly cleaned up before

Amaizing views,impecable place( there is people cleaning all day) ,and security around A long Malecont to walk e with benches to rest and direct acces to the beach and full of restaurants in front of the street. Only negative for me is in some places it needed a kind of
There are many sculptures along the Malecon and they are beautiful. Also, the view of the ocean in spectacular, especially at sunset!
Beautiful and clean Malecon. Great for walking day or evening, lot's of restaurants and stores across the main road.
Several miles of winding, diverse, concrete walkway of the water-side of the main road, across from the many shops, bars and eateries. Stunning!

We stayed at Hotel Marina which is at the far north end of the Malecón. We were able to walk from our hotel all the way down the Malecón to the other marina. It's about 3 miles with the turquoise ocean on one side, with shops and businesses on the other. The sidewalk is very

I walked the whole thing one morning, bay and restaurant side. The bay side had sections shut down for construction, but joggers were out and about anyway. Had a second breakfast at a place on the north east part of the Malecon (boardwalk). I think the north east end has more
This is a great place for an early morning run or an evening stroll. Find a spot at one of the many restaurants and people watch! Great way to spend some time in La Paz.
La paz is sure going the extra mile with the malecon, new improvements, new additions. It all looks great and I can hardly wait to see how it all turns out.

Cant have a proper Latin America City without a thriving Malecon. La Paz's delivers with fun, cultural interaction, oodles of public art, beach on one side, and endless bars and restaurants on the other side.

The Malecon is a nice wide, clean path along the waterfront in La Paz. Has great ocean views and a nice breeze to keep you cool. It’s also an arts scene, as it’s lined with different bronze statues, some fun, some whimsical, some religious. After being on a cruise ship for a
This is a nice maleco. You can take pic with La Paz sign and walk and walk. The area is nice and calm. There were areas still under construction but it was ok. It’s going to end up looking nice.
Very nice Malecón. There is a bike running lane and traffic was very polite. Restaurants and coffee shops are all around and there are nice playgrounds for kids.

Day or night....the malecon delivers!. Fantastic sushi.suberb original margueritas. Mojitis and local delisce drinks!!!! What more can one ask!? ...oh....white sand beaches with romance in the air!!!??? Of course! Hello!!!? Malecon....take your lover there ;)

The Malecon actually begins well south of the city. Many people walk, jog and bike it. It was really clean. There were workers sweeping it daily while I was there. La Paz in general was very clean but the Malecon was spotless. There are plenty of shops and restaurants

Another must see, MUST WALK!! Beauty of la Paz. It must be around 3-4.5 miles of beautiful sightseeing walking, with statues to take pictures with, exercise bars, docks to take a beautiful sunset picture, and delicious snacks stands all over it. If you like skating or riding
This is where the limited tourist amenities are for La Paz. Restaurants, gift shops etc. They are spread out a bit. The Bay is nice to view.

Really nice walking path and cycling path. They are doing work improving it even more. Has benches to sit and watch the water. Restaurants across the street have unobstructed views of the water too. Just lovely
I love this place with all my heart! I just love walk and buy a ice cream while listen music and watch the different but beautiful views...

Long, smooth and very nice. Gives the ability to look at all the places to eat and drink while walking whitout being harassed. Long long walk. And as i said very smooth do the kids can dkateboard and ride all types of devices. Also good for anyone with mobility issues ... nice

A stroll along the Malecon in La Paz is not only good exercise, it gives visitors a glimpse of the choice of restaurants, bars and shops easily available, especially for those that don’t wish to venture out to “ the city.” One recent change in local laws that should be noted is

We walked this area after returning from snorkeling with whale sharks in the bay. The various sculptures along this walkway are beautiful and very well presented. It is fairly touristy here, but if you walk a block or two away from the water, you are immersed in the local

I love Mexico. Really love it. I have spent most of my Mexico time in Los Cabos. This was my first extended trip to La Paz and the highlight of the trip is the Malecon. Exceptionally clean and well cared for. Lots of people walking and roller blading. No one getting in

This is a beautiful place to go for a walk with the faimly, explore and take wonderful pictures. You can even rent bikes, and cruise threw the boradwalk, there is many places to eat all located around the way.

The town is cool, one of the better, cleaner areas along the beach. And gets more Mexican the deeper you good. Good separation of locals and gringos if you want to get away from them. Also nice active scene on the water front. And fantastic bike lane!!

We walked most of it but I think more fun way would be to rollerblade it. I enjoyed the sea related sculptures along the way but unfortunately most were damaged in some ways, mostly descriptions which originally appeared at the base had missing letters or were gone all together.

If you want to walk while you're enjoying an ice-cream or spending time with your friends, family or couple it's the perfect place to do it also for take pictures, ride a bike, running... U must do it.

Creative art, sparkling sea, happy people skating, hiking, biking, strolling, running along a five kilometer promenade. Plenty of good cafes and bars across the street. Great for evening strolls. My wife and I walked along the Malecon every day we were in La Paz. Explore the

It was a pleasant walk , people out there enjoying the view and exercising. Watch out for people on bikes that rather use the sauce walk instead of the bike lane on the street . Got to see some kids hit the ground while skateboarding or on their bikes doing tricks . Very

We spent a week in La Paz over the winter holiday and really enjoyed walking along the Malecon every day. There were so many local families with their children walking, roller skating, trying out new bikes and socializing. It made us feel like we were part of the community.

A very nice upgrade from the past. You can see many visitors as well as locals on their nightly walk in the evenings. Everyone gets their ice cream cone at the very busy place with the tree painted with polka dots. Sorry don't know the name, and then strolls by the waterfront.
Have made several trips to the Malecon for long walks. Excellent sidewalk and a separate bike lane. Several lovely public are installations.

The 3 mile malecon runs alongside restaurants and shops and the sea. Amazing view. Lots of benches, statues, places to stop and rest as well as locals and tourists enjoying the blue skies and sun. Great for strollers, bikes, wheelchairs, rollerblades and skateboards. The
Very clean. Lots of restaurants across the street. Lots of photo opportunities. There is a cute children's playground.
Well maintained walkway by the Sea of Cortez. Lovely music and decorations for the holidays. We relaxed and enjoyed the strolls along the way.
You can while away time, have a drink, watch sunset, watch people it is ideal for spending time at whatever your mood or plan.

El Malecon is a long walkway along the shoreline in La Paz, Mexico. The walkway is very wide and dotted with sculptures. All the business are on the other (inland) side of the street, so the views of the harbor and bay are unobstructed. A very pleasant place to stroll for

This four kilometre long boardwalk is the place that Mexicans and visitors frequent. You can buy fresh fish around 3pm when the boats come in. Lots of restaurants bars and nightclubs for Mexicans and tourists alike Walking jogging bike riding.

Nice for strolling, taking in the beauty of the water and all the sculptures, and seeing local families playing and working. Tour operators can get a little aggressive trying to get you to sign up for a tour, but it's not overwhelming.
The walk is very busy all the time with a lot of attractions waiting for the visitors. Despite the many people, you feel safe all the time and get to see the nice places La Paz has to offer.

Well lit and clean. Appeared very safe with women and elderly, locals and tourists, walking.jogging solo, even at night. Great for walking, bikes, scooters, skateboards, or roller blades. good nightlife shore-side across the street most places along the way.

The malecon is about 5km long. Lots to see and do. Many restaurants, bars and shops. If you like ice cream, there's probably a shop on every corner. Great for people watching, great for a brisk walk at night (to burn off the extra calories you may have consumed throughout the

This boardwalk runs about 3-4 miles with shopping and restaurants along it. The views of the bay for sunset are breathtaking. We got ice cream and sat for a hour just watching locals enjoy the boardwalk. You have a few local hand craft artist that make some beautiful art. Bars

Other reviews mentioned construction, but most of that was on a few side streets, nothing out of the ordinary for any city. It was clean, safe and hosted a lot of fun activities in the evenings. All kinds of restaurants and bars, and some shops, all on the waterfront. Locals
Lovely walkway along the main street of town. Nicely finished and maintained with artwork throughout.
Looking for something to eat or drink? Looking to get som exercise? Looking to do some people watching? Looking to get some pictures? You can do all this and more on the Malecon.
More then a mile long the malecon is a real treasure with many sculptures along the way.. A nightly walk is a great reward
Surprised at how clean and nice the Malecon is it's very relaxed people walking running rollerblading zero issues.

We really love La Paz and the Malecon really shows off this beautiful city. I really have to admire the city planner for not allowing bars, restaurants, and hotels to crowd out the waterfront. The malecon stretches for many km and on any given evening is full or people enjoying

We are staying for a few nights in a hotel overlooking the Malecon and it is a lively place day and evening. We arrived on a Sunday and it was very buy then. Now it's just people out getting their exercise or sitting enjoying the views. Kept very clean. Lovely long walks/ jogs
There are a lot of tourists and restaurants with very loud music. Nice for a walk during the day or night.

Beautiful walk along the Sea Of Cortez during sunset. An amazing sunset photo can be taken here. Plenty to do and amazing places to experience great food. Skating, jogging or cycling the Malecon is a must. This place is the jewel of Baja California.

During the day, you see a lot of people running and biking, at dusk you can watch the sunset and in the evening, you will see folks selling knickknacks and snacks. On the other side of the street, you have numerous bar and restaurant options!
When in La Paz (BCS) you must stroll the entire length of this lovely 'walkway'. There are many restaurants (across the street) and plenty of wildlife along the way ☺. Cheers
Great spot to explore town at night, get food fee the culture and see the culture of this Amazing California South town !!!
Its very nice especially on Fri, and Sat, evenings. Restaurants and Bars along the Malecon. We see families and couples walking along the pier.
It's a nice drive or walk. There is lots to see and some decent places to stop and eat. We really liked La Paz.

The beach is directly next to the Malecon, with no change in the level of the land, so you can literally just sit down under a permanently placed wooden palapa style sun umbrella. This is area has gently waved and a view of some docked boats to the far light, a cruise port

Long stretch against the coast where runners, rollerbladers, walkers gather - especially at the end of the day to catch the sunset and/or see the many beautiful sculptures that depict various facets of life in La Paz.

Go to the malecon and enjoy the beautiful sunset, I’m sure it is a beautiful sunrise too but I’m not a morning person so missed. Malecon can be crowded in the evening, a lot of bicycles but nothing to keep you out the place. Enjoy !!!
Even that was under construction, we still enjoyed the beuaty of the marine inspired statues and the beautiful sunsets. Besides de WHale Museum is the only thing worth to visit in the city
Nice and friendly people, fantastic fresh food, and a turquoise and calm sea. La Paz is a perfect place to relax.
This is one of the nicest malecones to walk great people and awesome sites. Lots of bars and restaurants and museum

....because there isn't. Goes for miles, nice view of the harbor and waterfront. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby, very little shopping except for usual Mexican trinkets. Not interested in returning, and I have been all over BCS.
Stroll along the malecon for miles and watch the dolphins playing in the bay. What could be better? Stop anywhere and enjoy a cold drink. Lots of fun for all.

The Malecon is so enjoyable. Their are so many activities going on at the same time. Beach volleyball right beside it, kids and adults riding bikes, rollerblading,eating ice cream, people watching, eating delicious food, watching the sunset to name a few.

Malecon is a very nice seaside resort. Lots of bars and restaurants for both families and couples. There is a good sea front promenade, with lots to see. The is a string of statues on the route to appreciate. Set back a couple of streets from the front is the shopping area. The

Lots of beautiful statues and tons of couples and families walking around. And of course right on the water. Great activity after dinner when you don’t want to go home just yet. Fun mix of locals and tourists!
Walking down the Malecón at sunset is a must do for locals and tourists. Grab an ice cream and enjoy the cool sea breezes which will bring 'Paz' to your soul after a long day on the beach or at sea.
This is a lovely, long walk along the bay at the edge of town with several impressive sculptures. On the historic part of the old town.

This is a lovely walk along the beach in La Paz. On the one side there are restaurants, shops, etc. On the other there is the beach and the Sea of Cortez. If you are in La Paz, I recommend a leisurely stroll along the Malecon.
Last week my friend and I went into a shop and I looked out just in time to see a dolphin feeding. He popped up twice fairly close to shore. Wow
Love the improvements La Paz is doing to the Malecon. It's really shaping up to be a beautiful project and really enhances the downtown feel.
Dotted with statues depicting the Gulf of California, this is a La Paz highlight. Join local families as they come out in the evening to socialize and relax.

....we'll be havin' some fun in Baja! La Paz is an interesting town. The boardwalk has a surprising diversity - boba cafe, high-end sushi, everyday local agua fresca stores where families order ice cream (served in an open snack chip bag, very clever!). Water is flat, flat,

You can spend hours here, enjoying the sounds and smells of the ocean, watching boats and people. I liked to go to the east side and grab ice cream and watch the people! The Sculptures are wonderfully done and make it very easy to land mark with
Nice beach. Easy parking. Lots of food options. Not a bad drive from Los Cabos. Very easy going spot.

We walked around a few nights with our young kiddos. They rented scooters and big wheels for them to rip around on, watched fish from the pier, bought some snacks and handmade jewelry from an artist one night. Didn’t stay out late but it was fun for sunset. Especially on the
Best golf ok California sunsets... Nice restaurants and pubs... Good food, and friendly ambient, La Paz people offer nice info from The best beaches in town

We came to la Paz to check out the beaches it is a big city but drive down to the boardwalk and explore. You can walk, bike, roller blade the whole shoreline. Grab a bite to eat. Watch the sunset and vise the shops.
If it to go for a walk, jog or bike ride it's a wonderful place to go for a stroll or just hand out and watch the sunset... Restaurants along the Malecon are awesome!!!

We stayed at The Perla hotel which is right on the Malecon. Along the Malecon you will see tons of statues, quaint restaurants and coffee shops. Just a couple blocks off the Malecon you find banks, shops and more restaurants. Well worth spending a couple of days here.

The Malecón in La Paz is beautiful lots going on and plenty of ocean views to keep you walking farther and farther. Shopping is across the street all along the walk as well. Very safe police are everywhere as traffic tends to be heavy. Lots of bicycles and roller blades. It

La Paz has a great malecon full of art scultures and beautiful views. It is very well maintained and wide so there is plenty of room for everyone. There is a nice little park towards the north that has a little shade in the evening. It is a great place to take a stroll or ride a

I really enjoyed this beautiful Malecón. It’s about 20min (non stop. Looks fat but it’s really not) walk from the main strip attraction. You can purchase tours, great food and souvenirs. The views are so beautiful. Once you start your walk from the first statue I believe by the
We had lots of fun walking the Malecon. You walk along the water. It's especially fun at night. Lots of nightlife, restaurants, and bars.
beautiful water, boats to watch, nice walkway, intersting statue/sculpture along the way. Excellent mango gellato a block or so from the whale museum

to see some great street art. Sculptures, murals, street markets with artisan crafts set up at night, all off the side streets from the malecon. I was a solo female traveler and felt entirely safe walking all around the area at night.

People giving this anything less that four or five stars are questionable, I just can't see why anyone would rate the La Paz Malecon as anything less that four or five stars. I didn't even bother to look at their comments, and you shouldn't either. This is a great, LONG,
We loved walking the Malecon everyday. It is beautiful to feel the breeze off the sea and plenty of spots on the beach to sit and enjoy the sunshine or a sunset.
An amazing Malecon, dotted with statues, and bike lanes so we felt safe riding our bikes. Very picturesque with lots of great eating places.

Three miles of sites, sounds, restaurants, sculptures, the best ice cream in town! Lots of tourists, but mostly from the area. A great contrast to the insanity of Cabo. Next time we're going to rent bikes and go all the way up and down it.
It's very nice to walk over there mainly at sunset. Several restaurants and gift shops across the Malecon.
so much fun...enjoy in the evening when all the locals are out strolling and watching the sunset. many interesting sculptures and art work along the way also

Great way to soak up Mexican seaside resort culture. Note 90% of people on Malecon are Mexican, so this is a refreshing change for anyone seeking antidote to the Cabo Resort experience. Quiet by day, busy at night - even on weekdays. Lots of nice restaurants, shops and cafes
The Malecon is a nice level walkway along the Beach in La Paz. It’s great for bikes,wheelchairs and scooters. Not much shade though. It’s across the street from lots of different restaurants.
Nice place for a stroll, was not too busy which was great. Lots of restaurants and a few souvenir shops

It's a nice walk along the Malecon. You'll see lots of shorebirds like pelicans, ibis, herons in the morning and if you are interested in art you'll find more than 10 interesting sculptures. Also very good for morning jogging - you'll even find some fitness equipment on the way.
La Paz did it right. No highrise hotels blocking the beaches from view. It was a delightful change from Cabo,and San Jose del Cabo where most of the beaches are blocked from view.

We stayed in La Paz for 1week . Every morning we went for a run. It was so great to see so many lo calls out enjoying this place. Sunday night it was more festive with families and others out walking, enjoying the entertainment and venues. A must see in La Paz

We very much liked La Paz and nowhere is better to enjoy the local life than the malecón, the place to see and be seen. Great for an evening stroll, a drink watching the sunset, an ice cream or dinner.

It's nice during the day, a well done walkway along the foreshore, but can get a bit hot. But in the evening and night the place comes alive with both locals and tourists. They walk, ride, skate along the Malecon or just sit at one of the many restaurants or bars that line the

Malecòn translates roughly to "boardwalk" and this one extends right alongside La Paz Bay for miles. There are a lot of really fantastic statues and it is incredibly well lit at night. Enjoy watching the boats or stop in and grab some food at the local establishments.

Walking the malecon is a personal favorite of ours....always lively! The sidewalks have been spruced up and the streets widened so that there is more parking at the beginning or south end of the malecon.

The Malecon, or break water, runs for approximately 2 KM along the waterfront of La Paz. Walking paths are nicely constructed ( and under construction at the moment) and there are interesting large scale sculptures every few hundred yards. There are numerous bars, restaurants

We started out as a walk down the Malecon and then rented bikes (which I highly recommend). All the restaurants and shops are on one side and the beach on the other! We've been to several Malecons in Mexico. This is one of the best with the fewest peddlers. You can stroll along
A bit under construction on my visit, but still a nice walk and base to head inland and shop and eat.

Very touristie and commercial. Lots of very loud bars and restaurants that just scream “Spring Break!”- which is not at all what we expected or wanted in La Paz. Reminded me, and not in a good way, of Révolucion Avenue in Tijuana 20years ago, of of Squid Roe in Cabo every

The people the restaurants the shoreline the seaside sculptures. We spent time there everyday of our trip to La Paz. This is a place I want to visit again and again. Boating marinas, scuba diving shops with a low key feel to it all. Personally, I liked it more than Cabo although
Great location for long power walks or for just sashaying along. Many Resteraunts many quaint shops. Lovely view of La Paz Bay

Great place to walk along the ocean side or cross the street and shop the commercial businesses. Sunsets are spectacular. Many social activities are held in this area with various sponsors through out the year. Restaurants all along the strip with various offerings. Tourism is a
Spent my days in La Paz walking half the Malecon in the morning and the other half in the evening. Love the views and people watching!

LA Paz Malecon keeps getting better and better! They have expanded the walkway and the food along the boardwalk is the best. I went during Carnaval which is celebrating before lent and it was Wonderful! There was a parade every night with floats, carnival rides, 4 music stages
Great first experience of Mexico. Tha Baja Coast, “the world’s aquarium” and swimming with Whale Sharks. WILD.
The views were great. The weather was perfect. There weren't really things to "do" other than a small playground. But the kids loved the long walk in the fresh air.

This bay front boulevard has been upgraded, and offers a variety of restaurants and shopping for over a kilometer. You can select fine dining, or walk safely off the main street a few blocks to enjoy street vendors. La fuente ice cream is amazing!
Walk for miles. Shops, restaurants,whale museum, exercise and play centers. Stay for hours night or day.
Love the Malecon, it has been refurbished and expanded since my last visit, even better than before. Just a nice place to walk and enjoy the view, people, and environment.

Great place to walk. Lots of sculptures. Very clean with lots of shops, bars and restaurants. We were there in February and they had just had a festival so a lot of the stages and food stalls were still there waiting to be taken away.
A great walk all along the water, cannot be beat! The city is clean and the artwork and path are pristine.!

The art work, sculptures and wall paintings is awesome. Great place to walk as far or as little as you want with lots of options for eating, drinking and entertainment. Awesome during carnival (week before Ash Tuesday).

Long, long promenade with shops, restaurants and a cycle-way. All with a fantastic view over blue water and blue sky.

Pretty walkway along the bay. People work hard at keeping it clean and we saw improvements being made all the time we were there. Driving along it is a bit of a challenge though....can get pretty busy!
This beach could have so much potential but unfortunately the beach is quite dirty and there is lots of construction going on. I would also advise not to swim here...

The city has been working on the boardwalk and it is looking good. A nice place to walk along the water. You can walk, ride a bike or roller blade. Nice place to relax and have a picnic with the family.
With the recent updating of the Malecon this walkway is spacious and well-lit and a huge bonus for this area.

This is where the tourist action begins. Plenty of restaurant options. We enjoyed breakfast on the beach and dinner while watching the promenade. Night transforms this place into a hot spot for bars and clubs. Had options for pop music and pub atmosphere, lots of outdoor patios,
The Malecon is a beautiful stretch along the shoreline. It is now under renovation and should be completed in four months. A great place where families gather at night to enjoy all the fun there.

This bulkhead boardwalk is being completed, and is lovely. Frequent artwork sculptures, wide, used by joggers, strollers, skaters. There is a separate bike path on the street adjacent. Attractive addition to the town.

I love strolling the Malecon especially after 5pm. People are skating, biking, running, and laughing, smiling, and waving. It's such a beautiful place to walk before or after dinner. When the construction is complete, I will be so happy!!!

It's a nice place for a stroll, a jog, or even to drive by in your car. I would walk it often and it's just a easemt place and it's nice to look at.
Loved walking the Malecon every evening. Beautiful scenery and access to great restaurants and bars.
Well worth spending an afternoin walking the area. Many great bars and restaurants as well as water activities and cultural destinations.

There's obviously been an effort to beautify this walkway round the bay. It's looking good so far with neat sections and great statues. It just needs to be finished and some seating provided along what might well become the Promenade to compare to The Prado!!

TheMalecon is beautiful and so pleasant to watch families strolling along together very clean ,💥wonderful sunset , nice whale shark excursion near by. Organic market couple blocks NE Tuesday and Saturday Am❤️

I loved walking along the malecon. Great restaurants and shops. Great place to get a coffee or ice cream and sit in the evening to people watch.

Restaurants, Tours, shops, bars, beach, parks, museums, and amazing sunsets are just a few of the things we love about the Malecon. It is the heart of La Paz.

Very pleasant Safe and fun walk along the beach on the Malecon. Families and kids on bikes and skate boards. great sunsets and not too many American tourists. Awesome sunsets!

Such a jewel of the Baja, a must do in LaPaz. Walking along the Malecon in LaPaz at sunset or after is such a wonderful thing.

There was construction when we were there. It seems like some of the businesses on the street had seen a better day. But the views and the artwork were very nice.

6 km walking path in the beach line. Very safe, local peoples dominated, no crowd tourists. Many local restaurants. I enjoyed walking in the malecon. Hope to visit there again.

Couldn't believe how beautiful the water was.. The people are too sweet. They have a few small shops that make you feel like you are in a small secluded city.
there are LA PAZ letters in there so you can miss them, you need to go and take that picture of you right there! you will like la paz

The Malecon is a beautiful promenade on the Sea of Cortez in La Paz. It's wide, it's beautiful and its well used throughout the week, but on Sundays it's full of families enjoying a stroll. Grandma, Mom, Dad, Teenagers and little kids. Some walking, some skating, some

We enjoyed walking up and down the malecon. This was the heart of the city and all walks of life were walking, biking, roller blading, exercising or just sitting and watching the sun set. Early morning and later in the evening were the best times to be out.
The Malecon is a lovely place to take evening strolls, this is when the place came alive because when we were there in August it was way too hot to be out during the day!
Great place for a wonderful walk, family gathering, for an afternoon run, very clean,lots of security, had a great time

This was the best malecon we visited during our drive along the length of the Baja Peninsula. My wife, myself and our dog found the seaside walk had something different each time we visited. This was a daily destination during our week in the city. Great spot to watch a pick-up
Great place to walk and shop around... Love the colorful street art and sculptures that are all around 😻💜✌🏽🌊🐳

What a good time we had we spent the day walking around visting all the local shops. If you have time vist the whale museum it all right on the water so when the sun goes down the breeze from the ocean great..

A great place to hang out with the locals. a great assortment of places to dine and shop.We would bike it every day and find a out of the way restaurant to stop at for a treat. There lots of little places tucked away.

During the day there is not a lot going on, but at night there are entertainers and food vendors galore. At the very end there is a small workout area that my son and I enjoyed.

We went to the Malecon, which is essentially the citys boardwalk. Very beautiful and very call place to go walk during the day. There are plenty of restaurants and things to see. If you go during the day, you might that it is a bit too hot, the locals don't come out until the

A walk and or lunch on the Malecon is a must do while in La Paz. The scenery is awesome with it ocean, beaches, harbour, restaurants, and many bronze sculptures. The best time is during Carnival in Febuary.
Great place for a stroll and to see the harbour, plenty of restaurants and bars but not too touristy. La Paz is a great taste of the real Mexico

The Malecon is a very wide walkway along the beach in La Paz. There are many sculptures and a wonderful view. Walking along it was very enjoyable. On the side away from the water there is a street lined with many businesses, including a lot of restaurants and some shady spots.

The Malecon is filled with impressive art. It was the destination for Ernest Hemmingway who wrote "The Pearl" and "Old Man and the Sea" that were inspired by La Paz.
After having a big meal, it's a great place to walk off those calories. Many Mexican families walk at 7pm. It starts cooling down. Only the gringo's walk in the heat of the day.

Great place to stroll morning, afternoon or evening to take in sights along the waterfront. Plenty to see and do-- restaurants, shops, music, water activity, etc. Nice place to watch beautiful sunsets too!
All you need in shops, beach, restaurants, seaview and beautiful sculptures. Will get quite lively as night falls. For hairdressers, local shops and manicure, go a street or two back.

Noisy, touristy but very pleasant. The walk along the coast. Is scattered with art, playgrounds, restaurants and bars. More Mexican tourists than Americans. We felt very safe with the federales on patrol.
The Malecon is used by everyone. It has many restaurants, bars, ice cream parlors and gift stores along it. Stop for a drink and someone you have met before will stop and say hi. Very friendly place.
This malecon goes on forever overlooking the turquoise waters of the Sea of Cortez. Very clean and lovely sculptures along the way.
A must if you are in La Paz, livelier at night, safe place for a walk or ride, as you can rent bicycles for next to nothing.

Beautiful views and a great place to walk around. Also some decent restaurants in the area. The water is beautiful here as well.

Just drove through here, but it had a beautiful beach, and lots of restaurants and shops. Similar to the Malecin in Puerto Vallarta, with lots of statues and art work along the way.

La Paz has a long Malecon which is exceptional for walking along the beach and takes you all the way through town. Many restaurants and activities along the way. Very friendly community and seemed very safe.

Take a stroll down this boardwalk day and night and enjoy the view. While your down there, stop at one of the many restaurants and bars along the way and be sure to stop at La Fuente for some good ice cream.

Beautiful resort. Lovely walks along the Malecon. If you get the chance to visit Baha California Sur take it. Amazing place.

A really beautiful walk along the LaPaz waterfront. Beautiful artwork and lots of great eateries. Take the time to take pictures of the many sea life inspired statues.

La Paz in town is a fun time well spent...Try Mind to eat ...Off main draw...Good food...Pleasant people...Walk to the harbor to greet COUSTEAU statue...Who said sea Cortez is ... World aquarium... Love La Paz...Quiet beach harbor town...thanks

My father and I stayed several days in La Paz and we parked the rental car and took a walk along the Malecon. It is very nice and clean. There are some piers and the water is clear so you can see some fish. There are some beaches along the way with very calm water.

This is the main activity area in La Paz. All the restaurants and bars go on for miles. Poeple come down to hang out with their kids and families and work out. They run, bike, you name it.

This long, approximately 5 km, boardwalk is a wonderful for for walking along downtown La Paz. It is very wide, with frequent and interesting artwork along its course. Also a great place to enjoy sunsets.

Plenty of space to run, walk or sit and relax wile checking out the shops and resaurants across the street.
Loved the bronze sculptures as we strolled Valentines evening. A beautiful place to catch the sunset.
Go any time of day....morning, afternoon or evening. The malecon walk is a treat. The view is lovely. Lots of places to sit and watch families, couples,etc. Lots of places to get snacks or a meal.

Great place for an early morning walk or rent a bike and travel up to 7 miles on bike lane and preview great sculptures on the beach wall. across the street, small cafe's and restaurants will satisfy your thirst and appetite.

Lots of restaurants and shops. Great place to be for the sunset. Lots to see. Great places to take photos.

The male on in La Paz is just beautiful. So many shops, so much to see, so many statues. The sunsets are just amazing and there is so much activity on the water. A great place to while away the hours.
Beautiful drive on malecon. Great for bicycling and walking. La Paz is a beautiful small city where you can find the real pace of the laid back mexican life style.
Shouldn't be missed if you have the opportunity. A great Mexican experience without the Cabo tourist schtick.
any time of day this is a great place to walk, people watch and enjoy the breeze off the water. So many shops and restaurants for food, drinks or ice cream
Must do in La Paz is a walk along the malecón. Lovely breeze and great places to stop along the way.

You never were in La Paz if you didn walked down the malecon or at least got into a car to drive from start to end multiple times drinking a beer while enjoying the views of your sorroundings. Period.

Lots of great restaurants; clean streets, friendly people. Beautiful view. Nice walking area. No obnoxious salespeople.

This is in central La Paz and along the water. Across the streets are places to shop, eat, or just relax with a beer or cocktail. It is a long street of walkway, but it is kept clean and easy to manage in an afternoon. You can sit and read or think along the way as well.

La Paz, Baja, Mexico isn't the hottest destination for American tourists, but if you want a working city on a crystal clear Sea of Cortez filled with whales and dolphins, and some of the best seafood in Baja, you won't mind the general disrepair of the sidewalks. Mermaid

This is the heart of La Paz, the waterfront. People are always there, riding bikes, walking, running, enjoying being by the sea. There are statues along the way, and restaurants along the other side of the road. In the evening, families congregate. Festivals are held here.
The Malecon is together with everyday's sunshine for us the main reason to visit La Paz, capital of Baja California, Mexico: it is about 6 kilometers long.

nice, scenic drive of the waterfront in La Paz; take a stroll and don't miss the ice cream shop with the tree in front, painted white with polka dots......Yum!
Great place to take a long or short walk, run, swim or sit on a bench and enjoy the view!! Stop for a beer at one of the restaurants facing the water or have a cold scoop of yummie ice cream!!!
Nice place to walk in the evening or on days when it is not that warm. The view is nice but not spectacular . Eat an ice cream and sit or walk and enjoy your holiday .
Lovely ocean walk through town with ice cream, restaurants, bars, shopping and people watching. Lots of photo opportunities and statues. La Paz was very clean and felt safe walking around.

We were only in La Paz for a day, but one of the highlights of the old town was the waterfront. No stopping, nice sculptures along the way, and lots of places to stop for ice cream or beer directly across the street. Great sea views too.
in the morning i would go for a run and in the evenings i would walk along, watch the sunset and then grab a beer.
What an amazing stretch of waterfront! I could walk and people watch for hours and not get bored. It's a slice of La Paz life.

Walked around for hours. great shops good food. Nice people. seemed really safe. will come back again.

As a place to spend some time walking around this can't be beat. We spent most of a half day walking the Malecon enjoying the sights & flavor of this part of the Baja. If you get tired just cross over for a clod drink at the many restaurants & bars. Pleasant & safe.

Clearly the. Pulse of La Paz. A wonderful stroll, or run, or skate, or cycle, or public crawl with scenery, art, people watching, what more could you want?

What a joy to walk along this long malecon. Many people use it as their morning exercise and others use it as their evening stroll. Try both!

Probably was great back in the days but now is dirt, spoiled and ruined with nothing special to attract
Wonderful, clean place to run or walk each day. Enjoyed the family atmosphere and the use by the local population

It´s a nice attraction and it´s perfect for a couple night walk, enjoying the warm weather. I don´t really think you can enjoy it during the day because La Paz is a very hot place. Don´t forget the sun blocker!
It was nice weather to sit in one of he benches and look out towards the Sea of Cortez, then stop for a coffee in a nearby local coffee shop

La Paz Malecon is veeeery long and it perfectly suits everyone who can not live without long distance evening stroll, jogging, bicycling, skateboarding, longboarding, roller-skating! It has a perfect view as you can see lots of sailing boats, hobby cats, simple boats, yachts

You should experience this before it gets overrun by tours and trust me just like other Mexican towns get discovered and people move there and soon becomes crowded. Now it enjoyable and in chanting. If you like to people watch, this is the place and little people having fun.
we spend Christmas in La Paz and enjoyed walking the malecon. There are some beautiful statues along the walk and they had it all decked out for the holidays.
We walked along the beach on the malecon a number of times over our 5 day stay in LaPaz. There are great restaurants and sites to see both day and night.
Clean with tons of families, restaurants, bars sitting on the Lagoon. Enjoyed ice cream while looking for boat operators to take us out to snorkel with the Whale Sharks.
Great place to hang out for beach, food and drink. Runs the length of town along the beach. Even good for families.

In the sweltering heat of a July days the Malecon is best at night. The entire town seems to be enjoying the cooler air and lively sounds after sunset. The ocean laps up onto the beach while families, couple and solo travelers stroll along.
Have to walk the Malecon in La Paz-- fun sculptures, lots of people walking and exercising, beautiful views of the ocean!

This is too good to be true. This tidal bay has a boardwalk that is well kept. We didnt expect such beauty from La Paz but were pleasantly surprised with a gorgeous water way. Unlike other cities in Mexico, i was never harassed by vendors on the waterfront here. Another plus!

The views and sculptures are wonderful. There are no vendors hawking their wares to harass you so can enjoy. At every block there's a new monumental sculpture. Across the street are all the stores, restaurants, and bars you could imagine. It's really long. It's suitable for

Nice place to walk along the shoreline. Good place to see the sunset, listen to music. Gift shops, street art, many restaurants. Almost every restaurant that we ate at while in La Paz was on the Malecon.

Walking the malecon is wonderful, both day and night. Perfectly safe. Many people, couples, families groups all enjoy strolling the malecon. Restaurants and bars at night. Best place to be for sunsets. It is the longest Malecon in Mexico
Perfect for biking or a stoll. Lots of great sculptures/artwork. Very scenic. Always something going on.
Love walking on the Malecon - both day and night. Always felt very safe and the locals were very friendly and helpful.
What's not to love about the Malecon in La Paz? Beaches, vistas, statues, happy people enjoying life. Great restaurants and night life. Boat tours to Isla Espiritu Santo. Loved this place so much.

Enjoyed this not so crowded waterfront strip for our day trip to La Paz. Not so over run with those trying to sell their wares. Got a pretty good deal down by Burger King (a tip we received to look for Captain Mike) to swim with the whale sharks.

Wonderful food from around the world all available on one gorgeous street meandering along the stunning Sea of Cortez. Fresh seafood, delicious al pastor pizza and much much more. Dont forget to stop in during the evening where they often have live music and other fun things

Tiled and/or paved walkway along the water, across the street from restaurants, shops, and hotels. Some points of interest along the way. The only issue is La Paz doesn't seem to have an ordinance or rule to clean up after your dog. Lots of families walk along here, people
No one hassled us to invest in a time share, or to buy cheap jewelry, or to enter their restaurant for "2-for-1 drinks" A far more civilized experience !!

Take the time to walk the Malecon especially at sunset. This is when the activity starts up and the beer tastes especially good.

Is where everything happens, you have everything from restaurants, bars, views, etc. You can just walk around and have a great time, there is also a line for bikes so you can have a great way to see the city.
Stroll along the Malecon and photograph the statues. Having said that, I expected it to be more beautiful than it was

The malecon is a lovely stroll with beach on one side and roadway on another. This gives an open view to the sea where one is able to sit for a while on the many benches along the way. There are also many small plazas and boardwalks along the way. It's a pleasant way to watch
Grab the kids and take a walk and enjoy an ice cream or twelve at la fuente we had a great time walking w the kids and grandparents too

Enjoy the beautiful Malecon, with its beautiful sculptures, you can exercise, take a long walk or just have an ice cream! And if you catch the sun set at the right time, you will never forget the beauty of the Vermejo Sky of La Paz. Give your self the gift of enjoying true
The Malecon is perfect for anyone who enjoys walking and seeing the sites. It goes along the whole waterfront for a good 5 miles.
The best Malecon I have found in all of Mexico hands down. It has to be at lest one mile long or longer.
La Paz is all about family and the place to go in the evening is the malecon. You will see toddlers on big wheels, teenagers on roller blades and couples old and young strolling along the malecon.

Great walk, be sure to venture a few blocks in too. The most turesty stuff is always on the beach, not a bad thing, but some of the more native and upscale places are just a bock in from the beach

Was there during independence Day. I saw a couple kids dancing. They can tear it up. It's a nice walk from restaurants to hotels, nice bars to stop and drink along the way. I have a video but can't upload.
Seaside walk with marinas and beaches. Statues spaced periodically. Stores and restaurants across the main drive. Not a lot of shade. Probably best to stroll early morning or late PM.

La Paz has a relaxed view from the malecon. You can ride a bicycle or use a roller. You con go to the market and appreciate "artesanias" and maybe bought some mexican curious. I recommend to visited the 12-40 coffee shop, it has an excelente service and a high quality coffee.
A nice place to walk , look at the statues and think about the world or just daydream. Plenty of places to eat on the other side of the street.

Very pretty and pleasant walk along the water front. Beautiful sculptures with ocean themes and white sandy beach. Take the time to stop and enjoy a cup of coffee or an ice cream at one of the spots along the malecon.

La Paz has a long (3 miles?) malecon, with shops and restaurants across the street. On the weekend there were festivals and live music in the main stage in the heart of the malecon. It seems to be the hub of the families and the town.
The Malecon is basically the center of town or the board walk. There are good restaurants, bars, shops and some museums....had a great time in a safe environment
Great place to take a walk, ride a bike or roller blade. Lots of families at night enjoying time together and meeting friends. Good place for an ice cream or a liquid refreshment.
This promenade goes along the city. It is quite nice and has nice statutes along it, though some parts of it feel less comfortable after dark.
Crowded, noisy, junky stalls, right on the water. lots of restaurants and bars to stop in.Went on a Sunday it was crazy busy,,,,went on Thursday nice and quiet.
La Paz is all about the Malecon. This is the heart of activity in the city, and there are plenty of excellent restaurants and cafes along the strip on one side, and gorgeous beach on the other.

The Malecon is a long promenade on the Bay of La Paz. There are thoughtfully placed benches in the shade of palm trees, and umbrella covered spots on the strands of beach where you can take a swim. Right across the street are good shops for browsing and outdoor bars and cafes

My hubby and I strolled up and down the Malecon. This is definitly made for all to enjoy. Took lots of pics of all the artwork up and down the area.
Best View of La Paz's beautiful sunset. Enjoyed early morning walks with my husband and Bichon. Shops, restaurants, coffee houses directly across the Malecon. One of La Paz' s precious jems.

Is the heart of La Paz, has a lot of sculptures, shops, restaturants, children playgrounds by the beach, a lot of people jogging, on their bicycles, etc. The best moment to be there is on sunset where you can take the best pics you can imagine.
They had a mini carnival set up for kids the night we were there. Mainly locals - or maybe tourist from the mainland. Perfect spot to get an ice cream and walk along the waterfront and people watch.
Walk the Malecon for people watching and bar bouncing. Families are out late and people are very kind
The Malecon is a great walk in La Paz, on the water, good to watch the sunset. People watching, right in the middle of all the restaurants and sites.

I enjoyed the malcontent because I went for walks everyday and it was always excellent, particularly at sunset. I took many photos and enjoyed sipping a coconut while sitting there.

While I fished with another outfit, Tailhunter restaurant proved to be our regular spot for drinks after a day on the water. Friendly and engaging staff, great carne asada and a comfortable place for tourists. Also affords magnificent views of the Bay!
One our favorite things while visiting was strolling the Malecon before and after dinner. Being a visitor, we felt very safe and welcomed to this unique area.

What a great idea is the Malecon, we would walk it everyday for the 10 days we were there. Lots of things happening on different days, the weather was beautiful, sunsets so brilliant. Loved all the statues along the way.

Malecon is the main street with ocean in La Paz, the tradition is to walk and join many people doing so every morning or during the sunset. Also is a local tradition to drive very slow with friends on nights of thursday, friday and saturday. Malecon has a big sidewalk.

The Malecon was an easy walk from my hotel Posada Luna Sol. I encountered both tourists and local families at play. The beach is small but gentle enough for young children. I found food available and reasonably priced from the hot dog cart on the boardwalk to the cafe patio

Love the Malecon, the families, the statues, the ice cream stores across the street. I've taken my granchildren many times and they always look forward to it.
A wonderful esplanade that is popular with the locals for evening strolls, jogging, riding etc. Local events seem to take place in the evenings when the summer heat subsides.

One of the nicest ways to enjoy the sea and to walk after a meal. There are really cool brass sculptures of sea life on the little circular plazas throughout. If you like to jog or bike it is a great place to do so. It is one of the really unique things of La Paz and the people

The prettiest walk along the beach front, or a great place to sit and people watch. the most incredible sun sets you will ever see

La Paz is in a really nice spot of the Pacific, clear water, beautiful breeze. It is not as warm as in the Caribbean or Golf, so even if it is noon it is possible to enjoy the Malecon. There are ice cream places, restaurants, stores in front of the Malecon & places to rent

There is always something going on in the malecon Nice to see families having fun there all the time . We enjoy stopping at the bars for happy hour with mostly locals and also having delicious ice cream A really authentic lovely Mexican town Love La Paz

If you either like to walk early, run on the boardwalk, take a drink, grab an ice cream, eat from a huge variety of options or attend a concert, there are plenty of options to choose from. The sightseeing is gorgeous.

If you're looking for a good beach location to relax and enjoy the sea, this is the right spot. Clean. Lots of store fronts along the coast. This is also a great place to go for a stroll (when it's not blazing hot).

LOVED walking/jogging along the Malecon each morning, highlight of my time in La Paz. Lots of locals enjoying the scenery, very safe, beautiful, the Ocean waters changes as you walk. Sculptures are lovely and add to the lure of the Sea.

Walked this area quite a few times in a 12 day stay in La Paz. Very laid back, good shops all around, fun night life, very safe area even at night. If you want a little less tourist area just walk 1 or 2 blocks into the city and you'll be there.

The easy strolling and the wonderful people-watching opportunities, as well as the sight of Mexican residents living their lives in this sweet old town make this one of the best Malecons I've experienced.
The malecón is ver y nice , a great place to walk , Run , beutifull sunsets , Also you Need to stop at la fuente for ice cream its delicias

One of the nice things about Mexico's Malecon's is that they have lots of local art along the walk, it makes for a very engaging experience. There are many places to sit and watch the water as well as people.
