Water can be a bit rough but the beach is clean and well kept. We took a taxi and gave him a pick up time about 2 hours is probably enough. Brink some water as it can get incredibly HOT in the summer.

Finally explored another beach between Cabo San Lucas and San Jose del Cabo. What a magnificent setting. Sad we didn’t stumble upon it earlier. We will, for sure, revisit during our next trip down. Suggestions for your visit: -pack a lunch and drinks -bring towels, umbrella

We rented a car and beach hopped all along the corridor as the property we stayed at had a beach that was not swimmable. Santa Maria was beautiful and the sailboats anchored in the cove made for some nice pictures with the small mountain in the background along with the

Beautiful beach. Not crowded at all. Water felt great! It was perfectly blue and clear. Only downside was the waters were wayyyyy too rough for our one year old. The current nearly sucked us in one too many times 😬 other than that though..he loved it. We all did. I’d recommend

Gorgeous beach, but a little rough for swimming. Calmer on the right side - good for snorkeling; looked like there was a beach bar at that end, but we stayed on the quieter side. Great views, nice and relaxing.

Great beach access. Parking lot with restrooms and showers. Short walk to the quiet beach. The beach is not very sandy but small rocks so be sure to bring sandals or shoes. This can be a popular spot for snorkel cruises to stop and the snorkeling can get crowded then but it

I was in San josé del cabo with 22 of my family and friends. I stayed here while everyone stayed in all the bigger hotels around the same area. Everyone was jealous that even if they got all inclusive or breakfast included I still had the biggest room and the most open space.

We visited early June. It is a beautiful beach, it is smaller than Chinelo Beach. Unfortunately there was a red flag up on the day of our visit. The waves were rough and high, it was actually scary. So we did not go in the water. Though we could not snorkel, we saw crabs
I liked the beach a lot but its kind of far from San Lucas and more from San Jose. Its better if you rent a car to get there.

First of all, these local beaches are not all that easy to find for tourists driving themselves. We passed it at least once and had to turn around but eventually found it. There is a walk down there from the parking lot. From previous reviews I had read, I was so excited about

Santa Maria is one the three (3) sites people can go snorkel. I had fun in the water, considering that was my first time to snorkel, not bad as a starter. Our tour guide was so accommodating & was patiently instructing the group.

We spent few hours on this bay and we were amazed by its beautiful white sand beach. We did some snorkeling by our own and we saw a school of colorful tropical fish, we definately recommend this waters for first timers!

We've been going to Cabo every year for over 20 years and we have always loved our trips to Santa Maria - until now. Many years ago, they tore down the Twin Dolphins resort to make way for something new. We saw excavating and construction start slowly about three years ago.

An incredible beach with incredible snorkeling which was topped of by 45 minutes late in the day of Devil rays jumping as hey swam from one end of the beach to the other. I live moment we won’t forget!!! Do not miss this beach they are developing all around it so the gem will
Great place to get away from the noise and venders at Medano Beach. Bring your own drinks and food because there are no restaurants or bars here.

This little beach is definitely off the beaten path but it so worth a visit. If you don't have a car, fear not! It is accessible by boat and many snorkel tours will take you there as part of their adventures. I would suggest using a smaller tour company so you are not
Bring sunscreen, towel, snorkel gear,FISHIES FISHIES FISHIES! The view will be part of your best dreams afterward!
Love the Beach but could do with out the venders! But that doesnt take away from the beauty of the sands. Always such a great place to be with such amazing views!

We visit the Cabo area 3 times a year, and have been searching for the best swimmable beach with amazing snorkeling for beginners to experienced. Hands down so far, it's Santa Maria Cove. *It's small enough to feel relaxed without the hustle and bustle of Medano Beach. *Free
One of the few areas around cabo that you can swim at the beach safely. Took a snorkeling excursion here. Very clean nice beach.

one of the better beached in Los Cabos. very good people watching, lots of folks with families, swimming area, boats come in for snorkelers, you can even see the Cabo Pirate Ship! There are garbage cans and recycling on the beach. Very nice bathrooms and shower up near
water is nice and clear. not too rough or deep. not much of underwater life except fishes. reaching there from marina is a long ride
Pristine, clean, quiet, and spectacularly beautiful beach. Not overcrowded and an easy drive from Cabo San Lucas. We saw whales breaching just offshore.

Beautiful little beach. Go in the morning before the wind kicks up and the tourist boats arrive. Hundreds of fish - so many in fact it made my husband nervous. Saw angelfish, parrot fish, barracudas. Very cool place!
Beach is great. Nice boardwalk makes access easy. No facilities but does have toilets. Lifeguards too but no food, umbrellas or chairs

We gave this 4 stars because the beach and cove are beautiful. Free parking is available, as are free bathrooms and showers ( bring your own TP). Short walk down to the beach on a paved path with extensive and noisy luxury resort construction going on. Beach is lovely. Bring

Right next to Chileno beach. There is a free parking for plenty of cars. There is bathrooms and outdoor showers. (take your own toilet paper). There is a paved walkway to the beach with some ares are washed away with flood. Easy to carry your picnic stuff no problem. There

We were brought here on an excursion. We went for the snorkeling. Weather was great. Perhaps it was the day but it was the worst snorkeling we have ever seen anywhere we have been in the world. The beach was not populated . It was small. It was under a lot of construction.
Was there two days ago loved it .Get there early if you want a palapa otherwise you have to rent an umbrella, no shade. Good snorkeling,it gets busy when all the excrusions boats come in .

Located near Km 11 on the Transpeninsular/Main Highway (aka the Tourist Corridor), this horseshoe-shaped beach was my favorite in Cabo. There’s plenty of parking with clean restrooms and showers. A boardwalk leads from the parking area to the beach (just enough of a walk that
beautiful beach locatede in cabo san lucas, will visit it nextyear when we visit cabo again, with our families
Took a sail boat to get there. Good food and drinks on the boat. Fantastic snorkeling! Paddle boarding. Great time. Seen pod of whales on the way back to the marina.

Santa Maria Beach was one of the less busier beaches we visited. We went two different days to this beach and packed a cooler with drinks and food. There is a paved parking lot, bathrooms a five minute walk from the beach, and a paved path to the beach. Trash cans and recycling

Would love to come back some day when the weather is not so cool; this was an unusual spell,they said ( end of Feb 2018) ; but the beach was gorgeous. I wish they weren't building stuff so close to it..... but what a lovely view those condo swill have. I hear there are nice

This beach is more difficult to access. You have to walk much farther from the parking lot and it is not as developed. But there are fewer people. The water can be rough at the beach but it is very good snorkeling in a small cove that is well protected.

Even though a lot has changed here over the last 15 Year’s, this is still a great beach to visit and snorkel! The dirt road and isolation has been replaced with a proper parking lot and a new resort, but it’s still a great spot.
The beach here is lovely and clean, great for walking in the sand, right now the water is chilly but there are swimmers.

Went to Santa Maria beach to do some snorkeling, beach was nice although the sand is really rough on the beach. The water was choppy that day, and the visibility was down but otherwise its a nice place to go, and it actually has bathroom facilities and showers now as well.

This is a must experience for the Cabo area. You can check this one off your bucket list. The water is clear and deep and the fish area within reach of your fingertips. The colors are vibrant and the water is warm. We picked up mask and snorkels at the local Walmart and had a
Place is amazing, this is a public beach, however it is extremely clean, it has a wonderful view and a great vibe!!

Nice beach and great for snorkeling. IF you can get a private boat, which we did, see if you can find Martin around the PADI window near the end of the marina a short distance from Senor Frogs. He can be bartered with as many of them can so we got a good price for the 4 of us.

We went here from recommendations and we were pleasantly surprised! We sat on the beach and had some snacks and after a few hours some of us ran back to the condo we were staying at and made some lunch and brought it back for a beach side picnic. Great spot for families too.
Quite a bit of construction occurring. Sand is a challenge--deep, small pebbles but it is worth it! A gorgeous place to enjoy the ocean. Umbrellas, gorgeous water, great place to swim.

We fell in love with Santa Maria Beach several years ago and return each year to snorkel and relax on it's beautiful coral colored sand. Simply said, it is STUNNING! Because it is in a small cove, it is much smaller than Chileno beach just a few minutes down the road. The
Good snorkeling, peaceful beach. You can park in the large parking lot or get the bus to drop you off a short walk away.

Get here early to nab one of the 6 Palapas or bring your own umberella. Beautiful clean peaceful beach. There are Toilet facilities (lack of paper can be problematic) From late morning on, tourists boats anchor further out, beyond a 'roped off' area. We saw one vendor there the

Very Clean , water was so clear the beach is incredible and the snorkeling was amazing. There was only one vendor trying to sell stuff he was good when denied. Too bad they are building so close to such a nice public beach. Very enjoyable
We went here on a sailing trip, but you can take a taxi or water taxi. There were many varieties of fish to see near shore, but no corals.

We stayed at Hampton Suites in the corridor and needed a safe, public beach for snorkeling. This was it! We drove to 4 other beaches before choosing this one. We brought our own snorkeling gear but some was available for rental. We were able to rent 2 umbrellas easily. The only

Easy to get to and very quite in the morning . I reccomend getting there early as by mid afternoon a lot of private boats reach the spot and it change a little crowded. Bring water and lotions there are mio facilities nearby .
one of the greatest locations for snorkeling. the amount of tropical fish is unbelievable. a must for those visiting the area.

No need to visit by tour if you have a rental. If you do drive to the beach, make sure to get there in time if you want to get one of the existing (free of charge) palapas. Getting there before 10 usually works, maybe not in the weekend. Bring your beach stuff, snorkels, beach
Our luxury 4 hr cruise stopped here for a little over an hour for snorkling and lunch. We spent our time snorkling. So many fish down there! Loved this place!

It is too bad, as this lovely calm beach is undergoing the construction of a very large resort that goes right down to the top of the sand and covers about 2/3's of the width of the beach when you include the small beach front restaurant next door. The water is lovely and the

This beach is wonderful. It has a very good snorqueling area, there are many tours that arrive to do it. The beach has good access, and parking, has bathrooms and showers .. if you are lucky and there is water in them the facilities are good. It is a clean beach, for local

This is a beautiful beach! There was a large parking lot and bathrooms (no water as of Jan 4th 2018). The beach is cove-shaped, so it doesn't feel too crowded and the waters are very calm with some of the best snorkeling around! Tour boats can be irritating but don't stay long.
We had such a great day here! Best snorkel spot! 100,000's of fish!! We took a cab from our hotel to this beautiful spot!

We have visited this beach by car since 1994 and have always come expecting hoards of fish among the reefs in this somewhat magical bay. What was once a quaint park in the mid-90’s, we have watched as development has encroached and vendors park boats offloading dozens of
Best beach we have found, thanks to the staff at AVIS in the MEGA parking lot! Great snorkelling, with a great mix of local and tourist visitors.
A fantastic spot to swim and snorkel. Enjoy the clear water and the fish, just lovely. Great to take a picnic for a days outing. It can be reached by boat or car and is enjoyable for almost anyone.

A bit harder to find to as you need to watch the signs but a nice clean beach with parking and bathroom. Snorkeling is good on either side of the cove. Chileno is better for snorkeling but this cove is nicer when seas are rough as it is protected.
Did a lot of swimming here. Waves are gentle enough for safe swimming. saw a lot of fish in the water.
very beautiful beach to spend some time with your loved ones, sunsets are specially breath taking in the santa maria beach!
Great location for family fun. Many tours will take you there. One of the best beaches in Cabo. Definitely recommend it.

The concierge at Playa Grande recommended Pez Gato and we boarded a beautiful catamaran for the ~40-minute cruise to Santa Maria Beach. The crew was wonderful with a breakfast and lunch served before and after our snorkeling. A seemingly limitless variety of tropical fish was
We took a snorkeling trip to this beach and it's beautiful, saw lots of fish and water was warm. Nice beach as well and it was very calm the day we were there.

This is a beautiful spot that is fairly protected. You can park on the road and walk in. Place can get a little crowded, especially when the tours show up. Go early& bring your own snorkling equipment,
We snorkled here. Visability low, less than 10 feet. Unless someone feeding the fish, few numbers and low variety of fish. Not much or any coral.
Clean beach, decent snorkelling, no beach vendors, has washrooms and lots of parking. Will go back to this beach again!
This was one of two stops for our snorkel and beach hoppers tour with Cabo Expeditions. The fish were amazing! This is a must do if you love to snorkel!
Santa Maria Beach is about 15 minutes outside of Cabo on the Cabo Corridor. It is a quiet beach away from the crowds. The water is calm and swimmable. One of the better beaches in Cabo.

Heading to Santa Maria was on our first stop in exploring this area of Mexico. When arriving you do have to walk 5 minutes or so to get to water area. It's a paved in some area and gravel in others ( thinking parts of it were washed out in the last storm) but can be a very
not the best place to swim and dive but group safety and friendly help great boat ride with food and drinks/

Went there on a catamaran for snorkelling. The crew and boat were excellent. Unfortunately, there weren't that many fish in the bay and the shoreline was marred by a new resort being built. I can only imagine how beautiful the area was before the construction.
Stop here is a part of our tour to snorkel. It's a nice area that is being developed. Water was pretty cloudy and crew ended up chumming for fish to see. Nice area to relax for part of the day.
Beautiful safe beach. Lots of fish bring bread to feed them . You can take a car, or take a catamaran.
Very popular leading to churned-up water. Lots of fish but pretty cloudy. Some coral close to the rocks.
We expected a nicer beach but even there they built a Hotel complex. Too bad... we didn't see a lot of fishes.
We took a catamaran and spent some time on the beach and snorkelling there, it was great! Many fish there and if you bring some bread, they will be all over you.
Wonderful public beach with great snorkeling and also a large sandy beach area for plain swimming. There are umbrellas for shade and not too many vendors to bother you. Easy access and free parking.

We checked the beach out one evening and it was quiet with a nice calm surf rolling in and out. Hurricane Lydia had torn up some of the walkways but the shower area was still operating to clean sandy shoes. We returned a few days later and it was packed with locals and tourists
But the beach was a bit dirty.. Would go again, but defiantly not what I expected.. Alot of tours use this beach as a stop..

This is a jewel of a spot. It's a protected bay with lots of coral/pebble beach. Clear water with lots of fish. You could see some by wading at waters edge, but so many more by snorkeling along the rocky point at the far end. Tour boats do come in twice day, but have to
beautiful beach one of the most beautiful beaches we've seen in mexico and definitely a must visit if you are in cabo

Like Bahia Chileno, this place has become much more main stream and had almost 100 people on a Tuesday afternoon. Last time we were here there was 1 other person and that was only 5 years ago. The waves can get really rough and water clarity will get bad. It's still pretty

We came for the snorkeling but unfortunately the undertow was too strong (tropical depression Jova is moving out). Weather was beaufitul, beach is amazing. Very low key and hidden jewel. Must check it out if you are in Cabo. We got there at 11am on a Sunday morning and all the

Most of the boat trips stop here for the snorkling, or you can hire a taxi to drop you off and pick you up at an agreed time. The fish are close to the shore, and numerous and diverse. Parasols are for hire, and there is a small drinks kiosk. There is currently a hotel under
This beach area has been renovated within the last couple of years and has easy clean access. It is a beautiful little cove excellent for swimming and snorkeling. No riptides.
By far our favourite beach near Los Cabos. Amazing water. Great for snorkelling. The entire family loved it.
Palapas available (if you get there early) and a bathroom nearby.We rented a car, parked it in the now paved parking area, and had a wonderful time snorkeling -- lots of pretty fish to see!
This a a beautiful beach where you can do snorkel. It has a spectacular view.. when you rent a snorkel tour at the marina they will bring you here,so just rent a car and get there yourself

there's ongoing construction (looks like cottages or another resort) so close to the beach you can smell burning pitch or resin. i presume once it's done the beach will be over crowded. meanwhile, (as of July 2017) it's very clean, free with parking lot, life guard (who pays
this beach is a little bit hidden from the rest but it is so relaxing that i have to admit it is a hidden gem in cabo

This beach was by far our favorite on the Sea of Cortez side. We came on a Wednesday morning and it was deserted. Throughout the entire day, there were probably a total of 25 people on the beach. It was absolutely beautiful and we all had a great time swimming and snorkeling.
I think this is one of the better public beaches in Cabo. It is gorgous, and the views are spectactular.

Arriving at our hotel in Cabo and walking down to the beach by our hotel was one of the most disappointing things about Mexico for me. I was expecting to be able to lay out a towel and sit for hours in serenity. Instead I found it was loud and crowded and there was no where to
Worth the drive to get to this swim-able beach. Very clean, and well protected from the big waves. Good parking,, restrooms and freshwater rinse off shower.

This is a beautiful bay with one of the safer areas for a family to take their kids to swim. We stayed in San Jose on Costa Azul, a stunning beach. Unfortunately, our beach quite often had big waves and a strong tow, even in the white wash. So in seeking a safer beach for the
Very very cold water! Powered through, but not super enjoyable. Too windy and rough for good viewing.

We decided to rent a car at our resort and go to a beach to spend the day. It was beautiful at Santa Maria however the sand is very course and not too pleasant to walk on. The facility is nice in that there are palapas for shade if you arrive early enough to grab one. Also,

We were recommended to come to the "Pink Sand" beach. Gorgeous beach with crystal blue water. Not really sand per say, more like pebbles/ small stones. Was hard on the feet and HOT . There are no services on this beach. The washrooms are a hike up the hill and there is zero

Our hotel recommended this beach to us for easy access and good facilities (i.e. bathrooms and showers, and covered "palapas" for us since my son is handicapped. I was so glad we came here. The handicapped access was great, and the beach was totally awesome. The Snorkeling

I hesitate to recommend it since I was hoping to keep it a secret, but it is better than the other ones close by. The There are no vendors. (Regretfully, not even massages.) Very quiet and the waves aren't as big. Decent snorkeling, especially if you bring some bread.

The parking lot, showers and bathrooms are at the entrance of the Bay. There is an approximate 2 minute walk from the parking lot to the beach and although it seems longer it is a short jot. Bring your umbrella, ice chest and snacks because you will want to be there all day. The

This small bay is one exit away from Chileno Beach. Most snorkeling excursions stops here and/or Chileno Beach. The fish are not as aggressive here compared to Chileno. They do not swim so close to shore. Great thing about this place is that there are flushing toilets and a

Took a snorkeling tour on a sail boat. No sailing. 90 people on board. They served alcohol before the snorkeling ( bad idea), no fins for snorkeling, Coral reefs are gone. Fish come because they through bread (not ecologic). Crowded beach. Not good for the money. Glorified

This looked like a very clean beach with some facilities. Very good area for snorkeling and diving. A swimming area is blocked off so boats don't run over swimmers. It looked like it gets a lot of boat traffic.
The snorkeling was great! Beautiful fish and clear water. They are building what will be a beautiful resort there.

And here is the reason: no hawkers selling you everything under the sun. There is no food here...bring your own. This is a quiet, serene beach. Snorkeling! Cabanas for shade. Parking. Easy walk on asphalt to the beach. Beautiful sand. We loved it here and even went one more time
Nice get away! Good swiming, snorkeling not as good in the afternoon. Free parking easy walk. NEED TO KEEP WRITING UNTIL I REACH 100 CHARACTERS SO I CAN SUBMIT THIS REVIEW...
Quiet location and great semi private beach to relax on, swim, snorkle and get tax on only a short distance from all of Cabo fun

This is my favorite beach in Cabo. It's swimmable, you can snorkel here, it's easy to find, plenty of parking and new bathrooms (by the parking lot). Once you park, you do have to walk down a paved pathway to get to the beach. There are a few palapa's there so if you want to

Well they have finally done it! Just left annual vacation in Cabo and went to Santa Maria for a day of relaxation and snorkeling. Completely surrounded by a damn resort! Yes it is now surrounded and a wall built down on the beach with the palapas on the Southwest side removed.

Santa Maria has changed a lot over the years. When I visited last month, construction was underway for hotels and/or condos. The path from the new parking lot down to the beach is longer than from the old dirt parking lot, but it’s paved. (Keep an eye out for desert iguanas.)

The beach has recently been upgraded with a new parking lot, rest rooms,showers and sidewalk to the beach. Snorkeling to the right side of the beach was awesome. The water temperature was at least 10 degrees warmer than that at Cabo San Lucas.

Great for snorkeling and they have a nice reef as well. We arrived here via Cabo Escape - Breakfast Snorkel Cruise and had a great time since there are lots of fish and will get near you so you can get some great shots of them.

Well marked beach- easy to find. Plentiful parking and new, clean restroom facilities. Meandering paved path past new condo construction takes you directly to a breathtaking cove like beach. While it is a 5 star view--this beach is NOT sand but small rocks. They are not sharp

whereas it is true that this beach is gorgeous you have to be careful because there is a lot of crime going on in cabo. we became victim of a criminal guard who was employed by the maravilla next to the beach robbing my wallet and hiding it in the guard shed 50 meters back from

WE got there later in the morning but for $10 you can rent an umbrella for the day from a local vendor. There is construction going on right behind you at a resort on the beach which was annoying....avoid the construction areas and you should be fine.
Clear water. Busy bay with snorkeling tours. Go to the reefs at south end of beach for best experience.

If you want to swim in the Sea of Cortez, you can do it here. It gets crowded and parking becomes difficult, so it's best to arrive early. Combination of locals and visitors, no food/drink vendors, so come prepared.
Nice little beach and good escape from Cabo. Snorkeling right on the beach and not too crowded even during Easter week.

Finding a swimmable beach in Los Cabos can be very difficult... head to Santa Maria if you would like a swim and not have to deal with American tourists (like Medano beach in Cabo)... normally only locals :)
Great little bay with bathrooms and showers. It's a bit of a walk but very nice spot. Snorkling is quite good . Water is quite protected.

During our Cabo trip we visited Santa Maria Beach, Chileno Beach and Playa Cabo Bello (walking from where we stayed). We visited Santa Maria beach on 3/31/17 with young children (ages 6.5 and 4). I thought this beach was the most beautiful of the 3 we visited due to the rock

We visited Santa Maria Beach on a snorkeling excursion and were told we were not allowed on the beach. The beach is beautiful and set up in a nice little cove, however it is overrun with snorkeling excursion boats. The water was not very clear and pretty rough that day so it

Because of the tides I could not find a place to snorkel near the resort where I was staying. The concierge recommended Santa Maria Beach. It'a located about half way between San Jose del Cabo and Cabo San Lucas--an easy drive if you have a car, or take the bus each way (I
The reef and the different depths of the sea floor here are really interesting and pretty, lots of cool fish!

Get there early to secure a spot under one of the thatched huts on the beach. Bring a cooler with drinks, snacks, towels, snorkel gear & sunscreen then sit back and relax! So beautiful and protected. The only time on our week long trip to Cabo that I felt relaxed about the kids

My family and I visited this beach after reading the rave reviews. Our feet were screaming after walking on this beach. Very painful! I don't think any of the reviews mentioned that, so I am letting everyone know to wear water shoes!!!!!

We are more comfortable with snorkeling where we can wade in--this beach was perfect for that. There were a number of boats with spring-break students, but they were kept away from the family-oriented beach, which was great. The beach is clean, there is good parking, a clean
We loved this because because it was away from the business of Medano Beach. We got there around 8:30am and were one of the only ones there.

This is a breach that many locals know about. It's where many of the tour boats come for a day of snorkeling etc. it's a beautiful place with some palapa for shade and easy access to the water. There is even a handicap palapa. There is construction of a new hotel going on but

A wonderful family afternoon spent here, safe for swimming as its in a Cove and my 12-year old daughter had a great time snorkeling. There have been a lot of parking and pathway to the beach upgrading done over the last few years so ample parking even on a busy weekend and a

small beach, we took a bus to the beach, it let us across the street and we had to play frogger to get to other side. A long walk to beach, sand feels like small rocks not fun to walk on. The beach was pretty and good for snorkeling. I am not sure if this will be a great beach

This beach is the quiet local money spot we all look for on vacation. Feels like your own little island oasis. Pack a cooler and snack, because no venders. Little bit of a hike to get to the beach, but newly paved path - easy. Great snorkeling. All day the expensive catamaran
Its been a while since I've been there, but the parking was remote and a little scary at that time. The beach was nice with easy water entry and snorkeling. No bathroom or food.
Playa Santa Maria is a beautiful protected beach for swimming and snorkeling. There is a nice paved parking lot with a paved path down to the beach.

This was by far our favorite place to swim and snorkel. Ricky cliffs along both sides of the small bay provide excellent and safe snorkeling. Excellent restroom and shower facilities and a life guard from 7am-7pm make this a great sport for singles, couples or families. We went
Great beach with great new shower and bathrooms facilities. Never crowded on this off the out of the way beach.

Plan to arrive early since shade is limited. We stayed in a small shelter (palapa) good for 4 people.. If you like snorkel go to the right ending.. water was calm and clear. Saw some interesting fishes. Parking was easy. Toilettes are available near the parking., you will need
Just a very pleasant beach to visit. Be sure to bring sunscreen and beach shoes. Sand is granular and tender feet will complain
This beach is right down from grand fiesta Americana. So beautiful and calm which makes it great for snorkelling and swimming.

Awesome!!!!great little beach with good swimming, and great change facilities at top level ...we brought our own chairs and drinks and umbrella, but when leaving we seen a gentleman renting same at entrance to beach. No garbage and only 1 vendor and we were there 4 hrs. Also had

beautiful beach to swim and snorkel when there is no wind!, The problem is too many boats with loud obnoxious music! Better to go very early or late in the afternoon. We went ther many yrs ago and no one was there, now it is too popular and not as enjoyable!

The snorkeling here is awesome we got up early and we're in the water by 7am. Mornings are beautiful and the parking/showers are brand new. The beach was super clean, away from tourists,and the water was clear, deepest part was around 20 feet with a lot of rock reefs and lots of
One of the best Snorkel Bay's...You can catch a bus fro 2.00 there & back from anywhere downtown Cabo..Take a lunch, drinks & Snorkel gear..Or a cab, but it is costly

Lots of construction this year, but this remains a great location to snorkel. Take an umbrella and water as there is nothing on the beach. Snorkeling is good on both sides. Lots of tourist boats come in.

Just 15 minutes up the road from Cabo San Lucas - Santa Maria Beach is a lovely little get away. This is where the snorkel trips come - but the beach itself is very quiet. Free parking. Bring your snorkels - where the guides take paying guests is right off the beach!
Along with Chileno Bay, another of my favorite beaches. Chairs, umbrellas and snorkle equipment can be rented. Clear and calm waters, nice snorkeling. Limited facilities.

My wife and I love to go to the beach in Cabo, and I love to snorkel. Santa Maria Bay (and Beach) is absolutely gorgeous and one of our favorites! It is immaculately clean and the fish were crazy to watch! I highly recommend going, and get there early to get a palapa. Or you

Great beach to go snorkeling or swimming for a few hours however bring lots of water and some snacks because there is nowhere here to buy any. There are lots of tours offered for here to go kayaking and snorkeling however it's very easy to access by the public bus or renting a

Tried to go on three separate occasions, I think due to the land forms it creates a sort of wind tunnel. One that blasts off your skin when it picks up the sand. Additionally do not try swimming out to the cove on the right, its a wave crash point and will guarantee to injure
Beautiful beach but with a stone, pebble beach so bring swim shoes! Go early to get a 'natural' umbrella if it is very hot.
Very clean beach with excellent access. Snorkelling is among the best on the coast. Not much shade. There is a lifeguard on duty. Need a car to reach this beach but it's well worth it.

Visited this beautiful beach in a nice sheltered bay. After having been to chileno beach, this one in my opinion is not quite as good, the water gets deeper a lot faster so the kids wouldnt snorkel. There seemed to be noticeably less fish here as well. There are palapas &
This tour was very nice, good price and awesome ride to such a beautiful beach to snorkel around. You'll see lots of very colourful fish.

Spent a quite a few days sunbathing on this beach. Well looked after and clean. They provide shaded area with palapas. The snorkeling there is very good. The tour boat that charters snorkeling comes into the bay for the people to snorkel. Sometimes there is as much as 6 boats in
Nice beach. Might be busier on the weekends. Great snorkelling, nice clean restrooms on site. It is a bay and fewer waves than the outer coast. Lifeguard on site.

We booked a beach day trip from Barcelo Gran Faro. It was excellent as they provided all the Snorkel Gear, kayak and paddle board for us to use. Also beach blanket and lunch was included. It was a very good experience for me as it was early and very few people around for my 1st

Beautiful small beach used by some locals ! Very Clean you can also rent umbrellas there ! Great snorkelling you do get a few big day trip boats in there filled with people. But they are not allowed to come into the beach area water that's roped off ! Very private beach the odd
10 years since last spending an afternoon snorkeling, I was sadly disappointed at how over-trafficked this gem became. Boat after boat after boat, and the corals have paid the price
gorgeous public beach, not many places to swim but this is one of the best and was only 5 minutes from our hotel has on site washrooms, shower and paved path from parking to beach
Great for snorkeling. We joined Cabo Adventures for a snorkeling trip by boat. Left from town Marina. All equipment provided.
The beach is small and new resort is being constructed there. Sand is nice but beach is surrounded by rocks which can be dangerous. Water was clear snorkeling revealed lots of fish a pleasant area

Having a car allows us to easily go to the beach at Santa Maria. Some new changes this year...a paved parking lot and restrooms! Even a place to rinse off. On the downside, there is a huge condo complex going in...too bad, as it will mean more people here in the future. Most the
This beach is super beautiful. We saw whales in the distance. There were many snorkelers. We just enjoyed the scenery. There are no people selling things on this beach so it is very peaceful.
Great place for snorkeling, paddle boarding, and watching whales (in the winter months), and swimming beach.

We visited this beach on a snorkelling tour with Sunrider and I'm glad we booked the trip. The scenery is beautiful and the water was crystal clear, making it easy to see the large amount of fish swimming in the area. The beach wasn't over-crowded even though there were other

Came here on an excursion with Grayline - we did the kayaking and snorkeling tour to the bays. I had the time of my life. Water was awesome, coolest thing ever to see so many different types of fish. Wish I could do it again and again!!
There's so much construction going on in Cabo San Lucas- get to this beach while you can still enjoy the peaceful serenity!

We enjoyed a couple hours at Santa Maria Beach last week. My sister snorkelled for the entire time. I attempted snorkelling and climbed all over the rocks. Unfortunately we both got a couple stings from some invisible jellyfish. Not awful, but would be tough if it stung a child

Jeeze, I hate to even rate this place because I don't want that many people to know about it. The beach is beautiful, the water is calm, and the fish are abundant. There are absolutely no services here. There is, unfortunately, construction going on but I hope that the essence

snorkeling with cabo-adventures along this coral reef was awesome. First time snorkeling for us, and instructor guides were really good. Secluded beach but multiple buildings under construction coming soon!

We just returned home from a two week trip to Cabo. While there we decided to take a snorkeling excursion out to Santa Maria Beach. While I had not found a lot of really good places to snorkel in Cabo this turned out to be a great activity. Not only was the snorkeling excellent

What was once a pretty beach, in a peaceful location now has a building site at the rear of it so noise, dust and in time hundreds more people! So if you are looking for a quiet beach this may sadly no longer be the best choice although it's still a pretty beach. You also get

This is a great little beach for snorkeling which you can get to by car (it's a locals beach too) or by any snorkel cruise. We have been twice to this cove for snorkel fun and we love it. There's not a ton to see and they don't let you stay long but it's fun to cruise there. The
calm waters when we went and has inviting beach, easy float if you are a first time snorkle. we lunched on the beach. You can dive if you like. Nice variety of sea life

This lovely, secluded beach is slowly being gobbled up by a 2200 acres development. Parking is now by the highway with a significant walk to the beach. Now while they've added a paved pathway and shower/washroom facilities near the parking, the massive development takes away

A few minutes drive from downtown Cabo and you find this awesome beach - paved parking - clean washrooms - info booth - and calm waters for snorkeling, diving or swimming - soon though the private homes may ruin this area

We went around 9 am and were able to get a free shade structure. If there aren't any available and you didn't bring your own umbrella, there is a man renting them in the parking lot. The parking facilities were upgraded since our last visit and they now have a clean restroom.

It is a short walk to the beach from the parking lot. The washrooms are at the beginning of the path down to the beach. No dogs aloud on this beach. There are palapas to shade you but bring an umbrella for busier days. Also known as a good snorkeling area.

We had been spending time at our beach at the Hacienda del Mar and thought it would be nice to try another location. We had a rental car so we grabbed our towels and sun screen and made our way to Santa Maria Beach. The location is very nice and the snorkling ( I assume) in

This beach has a fair size parking lot but be prepared for a bit of a walk on a paved path. It's worth it. Sand here is pebbly so it wont stick to you like the fine stuff. The water is safe for even a poor swimmer like me but does get deep quickly. It's in a bay so a lot of

This beach is gorgeous. The sand was golden and the water is a bright, clear turquoise that is breathtaking. There is great snorkeling in the cove but it's a popular stop with tour boats, so try to arrange a time to visit outside of their schedules. Don't miss it!

We rented a car and stopped here for some snorkeling. Nice little beach, water was cooler than expected but the snorkeling was good. Lots of colorful fish and structure with the rocks under the surface. Get there early before everyone else!
This beach is a gem, easy access sparkling clear water Thousands of fish to observe even from the shallows of the beach

Biggest beach - best snorkeling and swimming in Cabo. Last year I accessed it from a dirt road off the highway and there were a few pit toilets (and few people). This year there is a paved road, parking lot and real toilets ... and about eight buildings (a large resort) being

we were on a cruise and did the excursion to here....took a boat out of the Cabo harbor...it went by the Cabo Arch, pretty cool... then motored like 30 mins away to this cove. there were a couple of other boat loads of ppl there, approx. 20 in the water total when we got
Beautiful beach, very close to Chileno Bay, it is quiet and clean with great snorkeling. Bring your own snacks, food and equipment, many snorkel tours come through here as well during the day.

There are a few good places in Los Cabos to snorkel and Santa Maria Beach is one of them. One way to get there is by taking a boat or snorkel cruise however it's arrive by land as there is plenty of parking. My suggestion is to arrive by 10 AM so that you can enjoy the

Heard that beach was nice, and went to snorkel. We took the blue public bus from Cabo San Lucas for 20 pesos per person and were dropped off at the intersection where it is a short walk to the beach. It is a pretty bay, but a large hotel is being built which does detract

Great spot for families or beginning to learn to snorkel. Its a semi protected cove with the right side hosting the calmer of the two sides to snorkel and see fish. Many species here but no major schools. The left side was a little rougher water but still manageable for the
I had read that there were no facilities at Santa Maria Beach, so I was pleasantly surprised to find that there were washrooms and umbrellas there. The swimming and snorkelling were good.

This is just outside Cabo San Lucas on the way to San Jose Del Cabo. It has a new parking lot with bathrooms and showers. The walk to the beach is about 150 yards, but is not an issue as the path is paved. The sand on this beach is very corse, so you will get a good foot scrub.

Beautiful fish! Warm water. Kid friendly with protected cove and minimal waves. You can either drive to the beach or take one of the boat snorkeling tours. Take a picnic and stay a while. The kids will love it!

Pack a cooler, and plan to spend the day here. It's an awesome beach that is relatively uncrowded and beautiful. Don't pay for a snorkeling trip when you can snorkel for free. All the snorkeling boats come and go, but still, it's very relaxing and worth it. If you are using

We took a morning snorkeling tour with a local dive company. The guides were great and made the trip fun. We visited two bays - Santa Rosita Bay (on Santa Maria Beach) and Chileno Bay. I have to say that the snorkeling in Santa Rosita Bay was much better. Perhaps it was the
Area not crowded nor huge waves making it family friendly. Many amenities nearby. Some rocks that offer area for viewing tropical fish. Public parking was available at no cost.
Beautiful water and good snorkeling. You'll see many types of fish in the clear blue water. It is a bit crowded at times with all the snorkel tours coming and going.
great beach have fun enjoy.has great sand and what more is there to say who does not love a great beach cheers

We spent the day at Santa Maria playa and had a fantastic day of snorkelling and fun. The water is very clear and there is an abundance of fish to watch. We caught the bus in SJDC and for 28 pesos each, and we were dropped off on the side of the highway where the entrance is.
Easy walking along beach. Go north to the point and see new hotels or south to the peers and Old Town Cabo.
Beautiful beach that also was very well kept. Restrooms were also nearby and parking was plentiful. Well worth checking out.
we visited this beach on a snorkeling trip. Great waters and plenty of fish. the beach looked nice but we enjoyed the waters

We did Medano beach one day and then wanted to try a more quiet beach. This was great! It is a little bit of a walk from the parking lot to beach with chairs, umbrella, etc in hand - but worth it. The beach was not crowded at all. This appears to be an area that the

This is an easy car ride from Cabo San Lucas. Very family friendly with clean wash/change room and paved walkway from parking lot to beach. Snorkelling was great on the right side of the beach. Many tour boats come to snorkel too but tend to be further out
Excellent location for snorkelling. We went there as a group from Cabo Adventures. Our guide was Pepe. He spoken in English and Spanish very very fast.

Playa Santa Maria is a great place to go snorkeling and hanging out on the beach. Bring your own drinks and shade (no glass). The sand however, is not truly sand, it's more like pebbles, so it's a good idea to wear water shoes if you have tender feet.

Bring your own umbrellas and chairs and drinks and snorkel equipment, as there are none provided here. The sand is tiny little pebbles and very hot, but the water is wonderful. Snorkle around the rocks for good views of any number of fish. The downside is that the tourist
We stopped by today to see this beach. It is gorgeous! Has showers outside and bathrooms! Highly recommend! I would definitely wear water shoes. The beach is made of small stones.

Beautiful beach. However there are condos or hotels being built there. This will probably change the natural beauty of this beach as more and more people use it. I hope this doesn't happen, but the places being built look like large capacity lodgings.
great beach experience: few people, public clean beach. Loved it. Recommend everyone to go. Nice nice nice

We loved snorkeling on this beautiful cove. There is a good variety of fish to be seen. As there is new development being constructed around the cove, they have built new restrooms and outdoor showers, a paved pathway to the beach and parking. Although it was a very SPECIAL

You will need a car, taxi or shuttle to get to this beach. Favorite for locals. Good snorkeling if the water is calm. Stay away from seaweed if present only because I got stung by a jelly fish in June when I was there. If this happens the lifeguard will give you the special

I'd still give this beach a 5 star even though the crazy construction are going on near this beach. Nice sandy beach, paved walkway to the beach, thanks to the new development grrr, ada accessible, restroom and showers, parking and rentals at the beach.

I took a snorkel excursion that included Santa Maria beach and Chileno Bay. Both were beautiful places but I enjoyed Santa Maria more just because it was less crowded. I never actually spent any time on the beach itself as I was in the water the whole time. But it looked very

We spent the morning at Santa Maria beach with friends and other beach goers. The parking area, washrooms and walkway to the beach are newer and in very good condition. There is a major resort being built beside the beach property, which will impact the nice feel of this beach
Great quiet beach with many many fish to view. Take some tortillas to feed the fish, they will come right to you,
Great swimming beach and easy to get to. Bring your snorkel gear and lunch. The Cabo bus route runs right past this b such on hiway 1.
Bring your own mask and snorkel and enjoy this warm sandy swimming spot. The fish weer abundant and it was easy to get in and out of the water.

Took a drive down the corridor to see the sights. Planned to snorkel but didn't feel well. The beach is a long hike from the parking lot. Lots of construction going on every where you look. Santa Maria and Chileno are where the snorkel tours go. Good place to go to get away

This is one of the places organized trips go for snorkeling and you can actually get there for free by car! This is a public beach but not busy at all. In addition if you get there early (I would think before 9am), you kind find a palapa to use also for free! There are indeed

This is a good snorkeling location. It's a popular destination for the snorkel cruises but you can also get there via car/taxi/bus since it is off the main highway outside of CSL. Great selection of reef fish. This last trip I even saw a 4 ft white tip shark taking a nap between
Great snorkelling with beautiful tropical fishes and crystal clear water. We went with Cabo Blue, lovely and fun team.

During our two week vacation to Cabo, we decided to rent a car through our resort Pueblo Bonito Montecristco Estates and explore the nearby public beaches. Santa Maria and Chileno Beach are about a 15 minute drive. The highway is great and driving was no problem. We had 2
Easy beach to find right off the highway with plenty of parking. The snorkeling was great here! The beach isn't nice fine sand, but it was still a fun beach to go to.

There is wonderful snorkeling and some shade The beach is beautiful not too crowded. The water is very warm. We had our own snorkeling gear so it was easy. But you can rent and take it there or go on a boat..

We drove to the beach and entered from there to do some snorkeling. So many people and boats made for unpleasant experience. The fish were not that plentiful. I am glad we didn't pay for a snorkeling trip. I would have been unhappy about paying such a high price for minimum
Beautiful beach....beautiful warm blue green water....beautiful fish seen while snorkeling. Brand new bathrooms with outdoor showers. Some palapas with shade. Wonderful day spent here!

Get there early enough to get a cabana, Snorkeling was alright water was a little rough. No Reefs but a good amount of fish. There is a shower and facilities near the parking lot but not place to buy food or drink.

As with other beaches in the area, the sand is coarse quartz sand rather than fine calcium sand. But the beach is very clean (raked every day from what I saw), and the snorkelling was well worth the drive from my resort (Riu Santa Fe). The water is a bit "aerated" from the

We asked an employee where he goes to the beach and he recommend this one. It's about 7 miles from downtown Cabo, so a car (or a bus)or taxi is required to get there. A beautiful beach with safe swimming. Take water towels/chairs and sunblock
Don't get too close to the rocks! I got cut up trying to look in tide pools and the lifeguards are oblivious to the beach patrons.

So glad we chose this beach! This was a wonderful little cove with great, almost clear water and lots of fish swimming all around you! Some tips if you go: make sure you arrange a taxi to and from. Once you're there, if you haven't pre-arranged a return trip, you can be
The water was beautiful and the fish were amazing. Recommended if you like to snorkel. The temperature was perfect.

My friends went around noon and said waves were too rough, we went around 5 and really enjoyed ourselves. It wasn't crowded at all and even found an available shade tree. Only downfall is sand was very hard on your feet best too wear a water shoe
A sweet getaway from the bustling medano beach. mostly a locals beach with some amenities. good snorkeling

Santa Maria Beach used to be a very secluded beach with few people around and far from the vendors of Medano Beach although rocky and with very course sand. Now it's almost completely surrounded by development. The bay is usually pretty calm but there's not much to see
Great beach! In front of a resort so there are options for renting equipment but also just a great place to swim and relax.

We went here with our local friend to snorkel and it was a great experience. There were no annoying beach vendors. It has free palapas, free bathrooms and showers, and the fish are beautiful and plenty. You can rent snorkel gear right there. Also, bring some beer and food
We went snorkeling, paddle boarding, and kayaking here. It was beautiful and there was a lot of diversity in the marine life.

This is a local beach with palapas for shade. There is a public restroom in the parking lot and it is a bit of a hike to the beach. The swimming is good. There are no amenities, so bring your own food and drink. On the plus side there are very few peddlers at this beach. We
This is beautiful beach for snorkeling. Looks like they are building big hotels around, so I am not sure for how long we will be able to enjoy this quiet beach.
This great to go snorkeling , the best place to see all kinds of fish and turtles , the water is always warm , go by boat or tour.
Good beach to enjoy. However, pretty big waves (maybe got unlucky with the weather). No people who try to sell to you. And construction taking place right next to it...

There is very loud construction equipment running on the sand. You can't get away from it. This beautiful bay is ruined. Used to be the best. It's still beautiful but with all the construction going on from all angles there is not a peaceful place on the beach because it echos
This was one of my favorite beaches in Cabo until all the construction started. It use to be quiet and peaceful but with the start of a new hotel it's very loud and soon to be crowded.
This beach is very developed with the change room and washroom and showers, and umbrellas. We came on Monday with was good as it was not as busy!!
We went on a 3 hour snorkeling expedition with Cabo Adventures.This beach was our second stop. Excellent snorkeling.

Awesome little beach with life guard on watch- the only issue is that they are in constant development and instead of listening to the waves breaking on the beach, you can only hear pounding of the construction behind. Hope this place doesn't turn into another Tulum, where you
Great Snorkeling at Santa Maria Beach!! It is a public beach, so anyone can Snorkel there. The water clarity was excellent the day we were there and we saw many beautiful fish.

This place was really stunning. A beautiful little cove 5 minutes drive from Fiesta Americana hotel. You feel so safe and the waves a just enough for the kids to really enjoy themselves. My only recommendation is to wear water/beach shoes as the granite pebbles can be tough
This is where you go on the snorkeling adventures. They also serve up a Mexican meal on board with free drinks!

This is a nice beach with good facilities (bathrooms). It was not crowded when we visited on a weekday in the middle of the afternoon. It is well maintained with a nice parking lot. The best thing about this beach is that it is in a lagoon that allows you to swim without big
Went here as part of Cabo Adventures. Abundant fish and even an octopus. SUP boards was fun and manageable on calm water days.
The best Place. For Snorkeling If you are driving to get there. don't forget to bring your lunch and drinks and umbrella
We spend a good morning at this beach, it is like a paradise! It has showers, bathrooms, free palapas & coastguard!

Only kidding, but I want to keep this gem a secret. LoL We visit every time we're in Cabo - usually more than once. It's a nice quiet place. The last few visits have been a little more crowded, so I think the word is out on this place.

Santa Maria Beach (Playa Santa Maria) is very scenic and clean. It's easy to find, esp. if driving north from Cabo San Lucas. Once there, you'll find a large parking lot (free) and clean bathrooms. The short walk to the beach is easy and the beach itself has shaded palapas (if

About a quarter mile walk to beach from parking. Showers and bathroom available at the top. Beach was clean and there were grass huts for shade, but get there early or bring an umbrella. Also, bring some sort of shoes. Beach is not sand, but tiny pebbles that get really hot and

The beach has a sign on the Carretera Transpeninsular Cabo-San Jose. It has facilities like restrooms, showers and a parking lot. No businesses or anybody selling you things, so pack a lunch and plenty of water. We had a great time!
Nice beach to visit, worth the drive or taxi ride. great for kids and couples if you want to get away.
we sure enjoy the beach and the water was very good to swim, watch sea lion pass by and stingrays jumping for food. very relaxing.
Very private quiet beach near downtown Cabo San Lucas. I would recommend this lovely beach to any family or couple who are looking for a quiet, relaxing afternoon in the sun and surf.

The beach was clean and safe. The beach also has a bathroom that was very clean. The beach itself was spotless. No garbage anywhere. Makes me somewhat sad that the beaches in Mexico and the beach facilities are cleaner and safer then man in California USA.

Very nice beach. The beach is like gravel from the bottom of a fish tank. The beach is located in a cove so it great for swimming and snorkeling. When you walk into the beach from the parking lot stay to the left.

Great beach... if only the sand in cabo wasn't so rough. Grass umbrellas provide plenty of shade. Snorkeling was amazing. Big fish, wall of fish, more to see than at the spot near los arcos. New parking lot, and bathrooms are modern and clean. Lifeguard on duty as well.
I'm not a fan of the beach so much right in Cabo. Playa Palmilla was my first favorite, this one come second or third. You must rent a car and explore other beaches while you are in Cabo.
This place is great to get out of the crowd. Serene and quaint with families spending time together. The waves are stifled enough you can swim safely. Sand is as white and powdery as you an hope for.

Getting to this beach is half the fun - lingering here is priceless. We took a public bus from the mall in Cabo to here. However, I should highlight the fact that you get dropped off on the side of the road/highway rather than at the beach. This means there is a bit of a

Great beach with huts and chill spots and wicked snorkeling/freediving. Tons of fish and marine life but don't leave your wetsuit at the hotel. The sand on this beach is very coarse and pebbly but a beautiful spot to relax, snorkel and get away from some of the more touristy

We can certainly testify that the sail tour was very relaxing and we learned a lot about the different rock formations. We had a snack of chips and fresh salsa. Then for lunch we had tuna stuffed tomato, melon balls, bread rolls, a brownie, and chips with a fish salsa. We went
It was a nice quiet beach but the rocks instead of sand hurt everyone's feet. The water is beautiful, but the waves got a little strong and we had a smaller child.

Hadn't been to Los Cabos in well over a decade and during our just completed family vacation, we stopped at Santa Maria Beach to check out the new access. The Twin Dolphin Hotel has been dropped and the new access to the beach is on the east side. It's well marked. The parking
We had a good time going snorkeling nearby this beach. It is beautiful and often not too busy. Definitely no hassle like near the marina.
Excellent place to lie on the beach and snorkel. Very good parking area and restrooms. Nice palm leaf/cabana style shaded areas.

This beach was amazing. The ocean is calm, so you can swim, wade, snorkel and dive. Its a great place to beginner snorkel. There are about 10-12 cabanas you can sit underneath if you don't want to sit in the sun. The ones in the back are big enough that we shared it with another

Debra and I chartered a catamaran for a 4-hour cruise with our family. I asked them to take us to Santa Maria Beach as part of the cruise so we could snorkel. We saw so many interesting fish! The bay, though small, was not crowded at all. The bay is protected from the Sea of

Great beach to visit. Very pretty setting. Sand a bit pebbly so take flip flops to walk on the sand. Parking a few minutes walk for the beach, but very safe with restrooms. Covered gazebos on the beach which are very nice. Water cold as this is on the Pacific side (Gulf side

Thus is a public swimmable beach positioned two thirds along the corridor, closer to San Lucas, that is being developed and cleaned up. There are built in palapas for shade and decent amount if beachfront. The water is super clean, clear, and cold.

The beach santa maria is a wonderful place which I fell in love, tranquility and beautiful sea is a beautiful painting in the memories of my life, definitely invite you to visit this beautiful place as well as to keep it as clean and beautiful, with the support of all we can

This beach has a brand new paved entrance, parking area. There are nice bathrooms at the main parking area. There is about a 200-300 yard paved walk down to the beach area. There are a couple dozen small grass hut type permanent tent structures to park your stuff. Excellent
Great place to escape from it all for a afternoon ,water is beautiful and plenty of fish to see nice place to bring a date or spouse,

We came here twice on two different excursions while we visited last week. I was a fun place to snorkel (swim area along rocks) you could see lots of fish and some big schools of fish. The water was calm in the morning but in the afternoon and the winds picked up it made it hard

We went snorkeling here and wow, so many fish!! the water was a bit cool in certain places, but the sun was so hot that it was quite refreshing. The beach itself is nice and quiet. Be sure to bring your own supplies (food, water, umbrella) as you are on your own!!

Open to the public. Very beautiful spot. Can snorkel and has spots where you lay under some little huts. Swimming is great here compared to some other locations. There was a lifeguard on duty also. Only sad part is the construction behind it of what looks to be for a

The walk from the parking lot was a little longer than expected. The beach was beautiful to look at; however, the beach itself was not meant for walking barefoot. More like pea gravel. It may have just been the day we were there, but the current was very strong, making it
Crystal clear waters and a variety of fish to see! Be careful around the coral and rocks in shallow water.

This spot has been mentioned by others for it's good snorkeling, which is has, but we were surprised by the guest services available. The services were so new and so outstanding that we questioned if we were at the right place. Brand new parking lot, walking path, facilities,

We came here on a sailboat day tour and snorkeled. Unfortunately when we were here it was windy and the water was not very clear but I was able to see some awesome fish that I have not seen before. The beach looks beautiful. I would love to come here for a day and just relax

We have been coming here for years, and always enjoy for a change From Medano Beach The snorkeling at the South end is pretty good, there are palapa so, a few fun vendors so nice for an outing They have recently upgraded the road, bathrooms, etc so worth a visit
This was the first time we went snorkeling, at first we were a little nervous but our guide help us.
We went there on a sail boat, which was an awesome tour. We booked through our hotel. Snorkelling was Way too windy to enjoy...couldn't get close to the rocks.
Get there early or on a weekday for a spot under a cabana. Awesome snorkeling! Locals favorite, clean restrooms & paved path from the parking lot to the beach.

This was also very nice for snorkeling. I even got to hold one of the "puff" fish which was a really neat experience. More variety of fish at Chileno, but the beach was nicer and there were thatch huts if you were able to get one (no cost).

THey have now cemented a walkway to the water from the parking lot and a few cabanas. Also added nice washrooms and showers. This is the perfect beach with small amounts of people during the week.Gets a little busy on Sundays as the locals come out and play. We did enjoy one

Beautiful beach, no pets allowed, very quiet. Great place to relax and take in the scenery. The sand is actually pebbles. Plenty of parking. There is a bit of a hike to the beach. There are covered/shaded areas to lounge under. Water is cold and can be choppy but you can
The hard part is getting there as we park on the road way and take about 1/2 mile hike in. The beach is nice and rustic, the water feels great and we like to snorkle here.
easy access; little grass shelters available to lounge under. easy parking. no charge to visit. less than 10 minute drive from Hacienda Encantada
Great beach, but no dogs allowed. Sad face Ample parking, easy to find. No hawkers. Beach chairs and umbrellas to rent. Worth the visit

This is the 4th time I've done the same 3 1/2 hour tour, great guides, wonderful sea to swim in, they provide all equipment, but I like to bring my own mask and snorkel! Feed the fish tortilla's is a real fun thing to do you are swarmed by fish eating right out of your hand.
Go in the morning if you can (when it's still quiet) and bring real shoes. The sand isn't sand. It's pebbles and it hurts--particularly if you've had a pedicure recently.
Good job people of Cabo for making this beach more tourist friendly. It now has showers, rest rooms and palapas.

This is a popular bay beach where a lot of tours come to let their people snorkel and paddle board. There's a nice little paved trail that leads from the parking down to the beach. Once on the beach the sand is very corse. In fact it's like itty bitty rocks that can be rough on

Santa Maria is one of the nicest beaches in the Cabo area. This is a blue flag beach so it is very well maintained. The sand is cleaned and raked daily, There are port a pottys down on the beach however up the walkway toward the parking lot there are very clean bathrooms with
The boats that anchor are distracting but still great. A new parking lot with bathrooms and showers. A paved walkway. Access to snorkeling.

Beautiful beach with lots of Palapas. The water can be rough at times and challenging for novice swimmers. Good for snorkelling. Does have public washrooms at the beach but.... The washrooms at the parking Lot are new and well kept.
Took a bus to the beach. Bus lets you out at the road and it is a nice walk down the sidewalk to the beach. Not crowded thru the week. Good time to go is 9am and stay 2-3 hours.
Great place to snorkel...bring your go-pro. On our visit the sea was very calm and beautiful a must see

Free parking, free beach admission (unlike New Jersey $) very clean. Outdoor showers. Bath rooms and snack bar. Snorkel equipment can be rented. Many new palapas provide much needed shade. Get here early in the day on weekends.

Accessible by Bus, which drops you off at the exit ramp from highway. You walk down and there is a dude renting out Snorkel setups with fins (bargin). Turn right go down to beach (walking pass construction). Good early to find spots and have beach to yourself. Come 10 or 11am,
You will not find a more beautiful beach. Hawaii takes the back seat to this spot. The sand is course but beautiful. Water is ice blue green and clear as crystal.

We went to this beach as part of a sailing tour in order to snorkel. The beach is on a small bay so it is protected from the wind. The snorkeling was very good - we saw a lot of fish. The beach looked very deserted, so if you are looking for a low key beach experience, this
The reef is dead here, but the fish are plentiful. This is a good swim beach if you want to get away from the crowds.

We drove ourselves to this great beach about 10 minutes from downtown Cabo San Lucas. No need to rent expensive tour packages. Just get or bring your own gear and this place is the perfect spot to wade in. Lots and lots of rock formations that go around the point and plenty of
Took a day trip snorkeling excursion to this location. Beautiful water, perfect for snorkeling. Tropical fish paradise.

Rented a car from Cabo to visit this beach. Beach was quiet and was surrounded by "mountains" which keeps the bay somewhat calm. Great snorkeling. Several snorkeling tours stopped, but were gone within an hour.

We went to the playa de Santa Maria for the first time last week. We were able to rent snorkeling gear for $13 each instead of buying the gear at Walmart for much more money. It was quiet and had few venders. There are bathrooms close to the beach and a paved walkway to get
we took a snorkel, SUP boards , canoes, motorized snorkel device trip on a small pontoon type boat . We saw a pod of sperm whales which was an added BONUS! $85 ea worth every penny

From the parking lot with restrooms and showers to the paved path and free shade cabanas this free access beach does not disappoint. We loved everything about this beach. There's a great area for swimming (with a life guard) or your can head over to the edges of this little

You'd expect this beach would be quiet, but no, those yachts come loaded of loud, obnoxious and inconsiderate gringos, boasting sound at full speaker volume. The beach is great, nice place for snorkeling, it's a little, safe, bay. You leave your car a short walk away, bring

Great beach (despite the nearby construction)! We arrived at about 10am and all the covered tables on the beach were taken but there were plenty of places to sit on the beach away from the crowds. We definitely enjoyed the snorkeling, though didn't see as many fish here as we

Easy drive from Cabo if you have a car - Lot of construction since we were here 10 yrs ago - paved lot and walkway, bath facilities in parking lot - still a long walk to the beach. But the beach is nice, with free palapa umbrellas if you're early enough, and the snorkeling is

We rode the power catamaran La Gringa to the beach and enjoyed the sun and surf. Beautiful secluded beach with large areas to swim and snorkel. Busy with boats it was fun to watch all the tourists enjoying their day. By mid afternoon the boats made their way back to their ports
This was an amazing beach with Palapas everywhere. Very Americanized compared to many other beaches; clean and newly renovated.

After extensive travel throughout the Caribbean I have to say this was one of the most picturesque beaches I have ever seen. The water was calm enough for our 5 year old to swim out and snorkel. It was gorgeous and we virtually had the place to ourselves. There were a few
Spent an afternoon at Santa Maria Beach. Much more quiet than Medano Beach. There are washrooms and lifeguards. The under-tow in the ocean is very strong, as it is at most beaches in Cabo.

This beach area is just amazing!! Palapa las to sit under, beach is absolutely the cleanest I have ever seen! And the snorkelling OMG the best I have ever done. So many fish almost as soon as u enter the water. We went to the far right side where the boats bring the tours.
Everything looked brand new from the exit, parking lot to bathrooms to the side walk to the beach where there are free tiki-huts to lie under. Hardly no vendors were there. Had a very relaxing time.
the most calm beach in the season , the water is so clear and beautiful , you can relax so much in the beach

If you want to snorkel with a myriad of tropical fish, this is the place to go. There are cabanas for shade and restrooms nearby. Spend your time in the water chasing the fish or get some sun on the beach. This is one of the few things to do in the Cabo area that is free. We

We had a car so this was a quick ten minute drive to claim our own sheltered spot on a beautiful bay beach under palm fronds. The best snorkeling with clear calm waters and beautiful beach was there to enjoy. Pack a lunch and beverages as this is a quiet location. They do have

Very beautiful well kept public beach..Bathrooms were very well kept and modernized...Lifeguard on duty. Shells were found..Swimming area, roped off..Shaded sitting area...Very nice way to spend a day away from the hustle and bustle of Cabo..
I loved this beach, it is very clean. Has a handicap ramp which is hard to find in Cabo. Beautiful fish at your fingertips.

Santa Maria Beach, or Playa Santa Maria is still as beautiful and scenic as it was 25 years years ago when I first visited this beach.Today there are more amenities including a lifeguard station, palapas for shade, public bathrooms, outdoor showers, a paved parking lot and easy

We went on a weekday and the beach was not crowded. It is very clean and there are facilities (Nice and clean) near the parking lot. There were quite a few boats anchored in the bay when we arrive, the tour companies take snorkeling excursions in this bay. We snorkeled on the
This was a short ride in car or bus from San Jose to a great little public beach, fully accessible. You'll find many charters will anchor in the bay as well.

Went on March 15 and there has been some improvements made. First, there is a large sign off the road and the road is now paved all the way. It takes you to a paved parking lot with security cameras, bathrooms, and showers. There is around a 200 yard walk on a paved sidewalk to
Very well maintained public beach with limited covered spots. Very picturesque setting. Sand is coarse in spots. Snorkeling is not too bad considering little or no coral.

We went snorkelling mid-morning when the waves were mellow. Lovely blue and yellow fish everywhere. A couple hours later, bigger waves made the water murky and several cruise boats from Cabo made it crowded. OK experience, but check the cruise ship schedule. There are a few

Spent a fun 1/2 day there snorkeling numerous times already. The tropical fish are breathtaking but we aware of the dangers that lurk underneath. Was caught in an undertow a few years ago and caught up in the coral and got really cut up on my hands. But it didn't stop me

We came back to our favourite beach this year and found our Mango Man gone! It looks like the have gentrified this great little beach by adding a paved path down to the beach from a paved parking lot, complete with showers and washrooms. The parking lot is so far from the beach
We sailed a catamaran to this beach for some paddle boarding and snorkeling. The water color was gorgeous and we viewed about every color fish while snorkeling. Fun Beach to visit!

We stayed at the Hacendia Endencata resort, so this beach is very close. They just finished the updates, to the parking lot is paved but a 1/2 mile walk to the beach. They added permanent restrooms and fresh water showers. They have free palapas and it's a good place to
Don't rely on the maps this is a great snorkeling beach don't use TA maps go down the hey and look for a sign get there in the am
I love this beach! It is very clean and the water is beautiful. There is a lifeguard and the number of beach vendors is very small

very nice snorkeling on beautiful beach, there are some lounge chairs and what appeared to be a concession stand of sorts. The sand is very rough in Cabo thought and so I preferred staying in the beautiful water with the fish.

There wasn't a sign off the highway like there is for Chileno Beach. I drove right past the dirt turn off road. It's right around MileMarker 12. It looked like they were going to start paving a road to it soon. Nevertheless, at the end of the dusty road is a tranquil beach

Santa Maria beach is one of the few spots that you can swim in the Cabo area. We visited there twice. My husband snorkeled both times and my son and I enjoyed relaxing on the beach as well as bouncing in the water and waves. This is also one of the spots that several of the

What a beautiful beach! Free of beach vendors, swimmable beach and beautiful waters. The sand is little pebbles, shells and pieces of coral - it just rolls right off your feet and doesn't stick to you like normal sand. It also looks peach/pink in person when the sun hits it -

We keep returning to this beach year after year. Palapas have been added since last year for shade with more to go up. A life guard station has been added as well. Toilet facilities are still portable units that were being pressure washed when we arrived. The sand is coarse but

Nice beach to snorkel and just swim at. Located between Cabo San Lucas and Cabo San Jose. Closer to San Lucas though. Lots of fish to see, take some fish food with you and they will swarm too you. Nice sand but be carful of the rocks while snorkelling lots of razor sharp

Make sure to get there early! Bring a small loaf of bread for fish! My girlfriend and I went to Santa Maria early on a Saturday and it was so quiet and beautiful... It starts to really get busy at noon depending on which day you go of course. However if you get there early

drove to the beach. road a little rough. sand/ pebbles is little tough on the feet,worth the trip, it's beautiful. snorkelling was good, saw lots of fish. some boats came into the bay for snorkeling tours but wasn't too busy.

This is a beautiful beach. The area is super clean and well taken care of. The swimming area is roped off and it's a safe place for little people to swim. The sand is large grained and the incline into the water steep.

From Cabo San Lucas, take any San Jose del Cabo bound bus from the bus stop in front of the marina for 15-30 pesos. Ask to be let out at Playa Santa Maria Beach. Walk toward the ocean 5-10 minutes down the dirt road to an amazing spot with good snorkeling! Smaller but marginally

We took a sail boat excursion to this beach. Less crowded and better water for swimming than beaches closer to Cabo. Others recommended this beach to us before we headed this way. Definitely recommend this if your looking to swim. Several others were snorkeling and said it

We took a bus from Cabo to the beach. It is really easy to ride the bus. We went toward the rock and snorkel. There were so many fish. The beach is pretty quite. It was a very relaxing day. This is a must do.
Come here to get away from the crowds and the hassle of Medano beach, beautiful little cove with great snorkeling. Must see.

This is one of the two best beaches for snorkling and you will find tour boats sharing the area but that doesn't have to interfere with your enjoyment from the sandy beach. Look for the sign to exit the main road around milepost 12. Then, swim out toward the rocky sides of the

Playa Santa Maria sits next to Playa Chileno, which we love but only wish it provides for bit more shade. Santa Maria has a few huts for shade on a first-come-first-served basis. Like Chileno, it's still nice now but within a year or so, it will have new development right on
Santa Maria Beach is a great beach to relax. It's a smaller beach, not to much people. If you have the gear, it's a good snorkeling place. Acessible by car or bus. Ideal for children.

The water at Santa Maria Beach is so clear you can see the individual pebbles on the sea floor. We were there on a Thursday morning and had no problem parking and finding a free palapa (thatch umbrella). We were pleasantly surprised to see there were lifeguards at the beach.

If given the opportunity visit this quiet calm beach. Great for swimming and snorkelling. Pretty much guaranteed to see marine life. Even if just walking along the sides of this bay your chances of seeing fish and other marine life are very good. Bring water shoes and

Rent a car while you're in Los Cabos. You can easily get to Santa Maria beach and nearby Chileno beach. Both of these are accessible by bus but they're a long dusty walk from the highway. If you're carrying a cooler or a bunch of towels it may be a bit much. There are
